title: Senior fullstackutvecklare
description:
#### **Assignment Description**


Arbetsförmedlingen söker en senior fullstackutvecklare till enheten Fristående aktörer.

  

Uppdraget omfattar att som erfaren utvecklare bidra till förvaltning och modernisering av applikationer och bastjänster för fristående aktörer. Du förväntas arbeta i nära samarbete med teamet och delta i samtliga faser av utvecklingsarbetet, från kravhantering och teknisk design till implementation, testning och driftsättning. Du förväntas spela en nyckelroll i introduktionen av juniora systemutvecklare som kommer att anställas kring årsskiftet.


Arbetet innebär att:

* Säkerställa att befintliga applikationer och tjänster förvaltas och vidareutvecklas enligt gällande krav och riktlinjer.
* Bidra med teknisk expertis för att modernisera systemmiljön, inklusive migrering av funktionalitet till moderna plattformar.
* Utforma och implementera tekniska lösningar som stödjer integration med fristående aktörers system.
* Delta i felsökning och problemlösning för att säkerställa driftsäkerhet och stabilitet.
* Samarbeta med teamet i enlighet med agila metoder som Scrum eller Kanban för att leverera i tid till deadlines under 2025.


Du ska arbeta enligt Arbetsförmedlingens riktlinjer och säkerställa att leveranser håller hög kvalitet och uppfyller verksamhetsmål.


SKALL-KRAV


Du ska ha:

* minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av Java,SQL, Oracle samt REST, med arbete utfört de senaste 6 åren.
* minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av OpenShift-plattformen.
* dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling och underhåll av stora och komplexa systemmiljöer med minst 5000 användare.
* erfarenhet av arbete i agila team enligt ramverk som Scrum eller Kanban.
* kompetens inom teknisk design och datamodellering.
* erfarenhet av att konfigurera och optimera pipelines med Tekton.
* dokumenterad erfarenhet av användarsupport, inklusive felsökning och problemlösning.
* erfarenhet av arbete inom statliga myndigheter.
* Du ska kunna kommunicera på svenska i både tal och skrift.


MERITERANDE


Du bör ha dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av:


a) erfarenhet av att använda verktyg som IntelliJ, Jira, Confluence, Git, Bitbucket, Argo CD.


b) kunskap om tekniker och ramverk såsom Jakarta EE, Spring Boot, JBoss EAP, Quarkus, Maven, Oracle SQL, ActiveMQ, SoapUI, REST, HTML, CSS, Javascript.


c) erfarenhet av integrationer med upphandlingssystem, exempelvis Mercell Tendsign.


#### **Other relevant information**


Omfattning: 100%


Avtalslängd: 2025-09-01 - 2026-08-31. Uppdraget kan förlängas med 6 månader.


Stationeringsort: Arbetet sker i Arbetsförmedlingens lokaler i Solna.


Sök senast 14 Augusti 2025.

title: AI Powered Fullstack Developer
description:
**Help us build the future of AI-driven software solutions**

**About Us**


We are a fast-growing technology company at the forefront of AI innovation, building cutting-edge solutions that transform how businesses operate. We partner with forward-thinking organizations who understand that AI is not just a tool – it's a strategic capability that drives growth, efficiency, and competitive advantage.


Our team combines deep technical expertise with business acumen, creating solutions that deliver measurable impact. We work in a collaborative, high-performing environment where innovation meets execution, and where every team member plays a crucial role in shaping the future of AI-powered applications.

**Your Mission**


As an AI Powered Fullstack Developer, your mission is to build sophisticated, scalable applications that harness the full potential of artificial intelligence—with a strong emphasis on creating exceptional frontend experiences. You will take ownership of crafting intuitive, high-performance user interfaces that make complex AI capabilities feel simple, fast, and delightful to use.

  

While you’ll work across the entire technology stack—from modern frontend frameworks to robust backend systems and AI integrations—your ability to envision, design, and implement outstanding UI/UX will be crucial to the success of our products. This is a role for someone who thrives when shaping how users interact with AI-powered applications, and who understands that a brilliant frontend is just as important as powerful backend logic.  

  

**What You'll Do**

* **Lead the creation of engaging, high-quality frontends**using React, Angular, and modern UI patterns, ensuring seamless user experiences across devices and use cases.
* **Build end-to-end AI-powered applications** – from React and Angular frontends to TypeScript/Next.js and Python/Django backends
* **Architect and implement AI solutions** – including RAG systems, LangChain integrations, and API-based LLM implementations
* **Work with diverse system architectures** – contributing to large existing codebases while building new microservices and microfrontends
* **Leverage AI development tools** – using Cursor, Windsurf, GitHub Copilot and similar tools to maximize productivity and code quality
* **Collaborate across the organization** – working closely with business stakeholders, customers, and technical teams to deliver high-impact solutions
* **Drive technical excellence** – ensuring scalable, maintainable code while delivering features rapidly and iteratively
* 

**You Might Be a Fit If You...**

* **Have strong fullstack experience** with both Angular and React on the frontend, plus TypeScript (Next.js) and Python/Django on the backend
* **Are experienced in AI solution development** – you've built production AI applications using RAG, LangChain, or similar frameworks
* **Work daily with AI development tools** – Tools such as Cursor, Windsurf, GitHub and Copilot are part of your regular workflow
* **Have hands-on experience with LLM APIs** from OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, or similar providers
* **Thrive in diverse technical environments** – comfortable with large codebases, microservices, and microfrontend architectures
* **Excel in collaborative environments** – you enjoy both deep technical work and cross-functional collaboration


We're especially interested in candidates who:

* **Understand AI as a business enabler** – you see beyond the technology to the value it creates
* **Are passionate about rapid, iterative delivery** – you love shipping features that make an immediate impact
* **Combine technical depth with business awareness** – you can discuss architecture with engineers and value with stakeholders
* **Have a growth mindset** – you're curious, driven, and eager to explore new AI technologies and applications
* 

**What We Expect**


We set a high bar – and we're looking for someone who does too. In this role, you are expected to:

* **Deliver exceptional code and solutions** – you take full ownership of your work and are committed to technical excellence
* **Drive innovation with AI** – you don't just use AI tools, you actively explore how they can improve our products and processes
* **Move with urgency and precision** – you balance speed with quality, delivering robust solutions quickly
* **Collaborate effectively** – you communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* **Show up with curiosity and ownership** – you represent our technical standards in every interaction and bring a proactive mindset to problem-solving
* **Embrace continuous learning** – you stay current with AI developments and aren't afraid to experiment with new technologies

**What We Offer**

* **A chance to work at the cutting edge of AI technology** – building solutions that define the next generation of software applications
* **A meaningful role** where your technical expertise directly impacts business outcomes and customer success
* **A high-performing team** with modern development practices, AI-first tooling, and a culture of technical excellence
* **Strong technical foundation** – proven architectures, established development workflows, and access to the latest AI technologies
* **Flexible work environment** with modern development setups and collaborative spaces
* **An ambitious, innovative culture** that values ownership, experimentation, and shared technical wins
* **Opportunities for growth** in a fast-scaling company where AI expertise is highly valued and technical leadership is encouraged

**What Makes Us Unique**


We don't just build software – we create AI-powered solutions that solve real business challenges. We work with:

* **Technology as a strategic advantage** – understanding that AI implementation requires both technical excellence and business alignment
* **Rapid iteration and feedback loops** – connecting development efforts with measurable business outcomes
* **Long-term technical partnerships** – supporting sustainable growth through scalable, maintainable solutions
* 

Our approach reflects this commitment. We leverage the latest AI technologies not just because they're cutting-edge, but because they enable us to deliver exceptional value faster and more efficiently than traditional approaches.

**Interested****?**


Send us your CV, GitHub profile, or portfolio. If you believe AI should be at the center of modern software development, you might be exactly who we're looking for.


Let's build the future of AI-powered applications. Together.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.*


We’re looking for a Frontend Developer with a passion for frontend development to join our Product Growth team, focusing on optimizing our website and web sign-up funnel. Your mission is to help more people discover and get started with Natural Cycles by building seamless, user-friendly experiences that drive conversion.


You’ll play a key role in shaping the first touchpoints of the Natural Cycles experience – implementing experiments, running A/B tests, and iterating fast based on real-time results. Your work will directly impact growth and give you visibility into how your code influences key metrics.


We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, data-informed, and user-focused environment. You care about writing clean and scalable code, and enjoy experimenting and learning from the results. You shine in collaboration and communication, and take pride in being a responsible and autonomous team player. You're comfortable working remotely in a setting where asynchronous communication is the foundation.


If you're excited about building impactful user-facing features, love working closely with product managers, designers, and engineers, and want to make a real difference in women’s health, we’d love to hear from you!

 **Please note that we are hiring for this role in Sweden.**

 **What you will be doing**

* Ship top-quality, performant, accessible, inclusive user interfaces, features and products
* Work on Web components for our products
* Work in an agile team together with other developers, product manager, designers & testers
* Work in close collaboration with stakeholders across the organization to deliver top-quality user interfaces and features
* Work hands-on with data insights and analytics and if possible, always take the data driven approach
* Ensure continuous delivery of new releases while working in an agile way
* Maintain a healthy codebase

 **What skills and experience we think you have**

* Experience in frontend development: building websites, web applications, responsive layout
* Good understanding of modern CSS (e.g Flexbox, Grid), experience with modern pre/post-processors, such as SASS, PostCSS
* Experience with TypeScript and Angular framework (or ability to quickly learn)
* Experience working with git, github, pull requests, code review etc.
* Minimum 2 years of experience

  

**Not required but it would be a bonus if you also have:**

  

* Experience working with conversion rate optimization
* Commercial acumen and understanding of business drivers
* A passion for women’s health

  

**Our technology stack includes:**

* TypeScript, Node.js, Express.js running on GCP
* React Router 7, React, Angular, Capacitor, Ionic on the Frontend
* Firebase Hosting
* Highly automated CI pipelines (Github Actions)
* AppStore/GooglePlay releases on a biweekly basis
* We <3 Open Source, encourage Open Source contributions and often open our general-purpose repositories

 **Benefits of joining Natural Cycles:**

* Be part of a mission-driven company that is revolutionizing women’s health.
* Work on impactful projects with a team of top product managers, testers, engineers, and designers.
* See the immediate impact of your work through rapid experimentation and iteration.
* Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative, and data-driven environment.
* Enjoy a hybrid-remote work model with flexibility and great benefits.

  

Are you excited about technology, data-driven growth, and making a difference in women’s health? Apply now and help shape the future of Natural Cycles!

  

**Location**


We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the Product Growth team you will work with is located in Stockholm, and the team occasionally meets in the office for collaboration and face-to-face time.

 **Sounds interesting?**


If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.


We look forward to hearing from you!

 **How to apply**


To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.


At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.  

  

**Note****: We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies**

title: Baseband Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


Are you our next curious software professional to build our Baseband Software for 5G and 6G?
**About this opportunity**:

When joining **Ericsson**, you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology and you will have an opportunity to work with different teams to build networks and learn more about different technical domains. This is a place where you are welcomed as your own perfectly unique self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team.
Together with your team, you will be responsible for new functionality - from feature systemization to customer acceptance as well as maintenance of current products. The team systemize, design and test the software and take joint responsibility for all team tasks.
**What you will do**:
Your focus will be in the **Baseband SW** – which is a vital part in our current market leading 5G Radio Access Network (RAN) solution. We are looking for people to expand our teams, focusing on Scheduler (L2). Looking forward, the teams will move into6G as technology and standard progress. Together with your fellow Baseband SW developers, you will:* Build outstanding baseband software using C/C++, Python.
* Participate in the studies, implementation, and verification of new **5G** features and upcoming **6G** standard.
* Support and participate in innovation activities across organizations
* Work in a multi-functional, multi-cultural environment with supportive teammates.


The skills you bring:* **Master of Science** degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Wireless Communication, Electrical or Electronic Engineering or equivalent.
* Curiosity, a desire, and skills to be a great embedded software developer with a special interest in the **C/C++** programming language for real time systems.
* A forward-thinking, focused and creative personality. We love extraordinary teammates who enjoy a fast-paced work environment and challenges.
* **2-3 years** of experience as a developer will be a plus.
* Dedication and a genuine interest in the latest technology trends.
* Passion to wrestle with problems no one else has solved before.


You have an open mind and like to take on new challenges to continuously improve, and to work outside your own field to broaden your competence and get a deeper understanding of our products. In addition, we value knowledge and experience in 5G and 4G wireless communication e.g. 3GPP specifications, traffic scheduling, signal processing, RF or air interface measurements, x86 or multi-core DSP programming or design patterns in a real-time embedded environment.**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Lund

title: Senior frontendutvecklare
description:
Med 4 miljoner besökare per vecka och 80 miljoner sökningar i månaden är Hitta.se en av Sveriges största sajter. Nu söker vi en självgående och passionerad Frontendutvecklare som vill vara med och utveckla framtidens Hitta.se

### **Om rollen**


Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala tjänster med fokus på användarupplevelse och stabilitet? Vi söker nu en frontendutvecklare som vill ta en nyckelroll i vårt teknikteam.


Som frontendutvecklare på Hitta.se kommer du att arbeta med att utveckla användarnära funktioner, skapa tydliga strukturer och ta fram smarta designlösningar för våra applikationer. Du bygger återanvändbar och effektiv kod med fokus på att optimera laddningstider och leverera en sömlös upplevelse för våra användare. Tillsammans med produktteamet bidrar du till att skapa funktioner som gör verklig skillnad, med användaren i centrum.


Du blir en del av vårt kompetenta och engagerade teknikteam och rapporterar direkt till vår CTO. Rollen kombinerar strategiskt tänk med operativt arbete, och du får stort eget ansvar.


Tjänsten utgår från vårt ljusa och moderna kontor i Vasastan i Stockholm med möjlighet till remote-arbete två fasta dagar per vecka.

### **Dina ansvarsområden**

* Utveckla och vidareutveckla frontend-arkitekturen för våra webbapplikationer
* Designa och implementera användarvänliga gränssnitt och interaktioner
* Säkerställa hög prestanda och full funktionalitet på olika enheter och plattformar, inklusive mobil
* Skapa responsiva, tillgängliga och inkluderande användarupplevelser
* Arbeta nära våra designers för att omsätta idéer till konkreta lösningar
* Driva projekt från koncept till lanserad produkt med stort eget ansvar
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om nya tekniker, ramverk och metoder inom modern webbutveckling
* Vara ett tekniskt stöd och bidra till kunskapsdelning inom teamet

### **Vår tech stack**

* **Infrastuktur & DevOps:** Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, AWS, Grafana, Jenkins, ArgoCD
* **Development:** TypeScript/Node.js, Next.js, React, React Native samt vissa äldre Java/C# microservices
* **Data & Verktyg:** PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, ActiveMQ, Jenkins, GitHub Actions

### **Kvalifikationer och erfarenhet**

* Mycket goda kunskaper i grundläggande frontend-tekniker: HTML, CSS och JavaScript
* Erfarenhet av moderna webbframework, som exempelvis Next.js, samt grafiska designverktyg som till exempel Figma
* God förståelse för principerna bakom sökmotoroptimering (SEO)
* Erfarenhet av att bygga serverbaserade tjänster i exempelvis TypeScript
* Mycket god förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta tvärfunktionellt
* Organiserad och strukturerad med god projektledningsförmåga
* Duktig på att identifiera och lösa problem på ett effektivt sätt

  

**Meriterande**

* **AdTech:** implementering och optimering av annonsformat, programmatisk annonsering & header bidding
* **UX & grafisk design:** tidigare erfarenhet av att ta fram wireframes, prototyper och färdiga gränssnitt i verktyg som Figma

### **Om tjänsten**

* **Startdatum:** Så snart som möjligt
* **Placering:** På vårt huvudkontor, St Eriksgatan 119 i Stockholm
* **Sista ansökningsdatum:** Urval och intervjuer sker löpande dock senast 2025-09-07
* **Anställningsform:** Detta är en anställning hos Hitta.se och vi söker inte efter en konsult för denna roll
  

### **Om Hitta.se**


Hitta.se är Sveriges lokala online-marknadsplats som erbjuder tjänster för att enkelt och snabbt hitta relevant information om företag, personer och platser. Samtidigt erbjuder vi våra företagskunder en bred portfölj av innovativa tjänster och produkter som förenklar vardagen, attraherar kunder och ökar försäljningen.


Hitta.se grundades 2004 och har idag cirka 60 anställda på kontoret på Sankt Eriksgatan. Hitta.se är en av Sveriges största sajter med en räckvidd på över 4 miljoner unika besökare per vecka.


Sedan december 2024 är Hitta.se en del av Fonecta Group Oy, Finlands främsta aktör inom söktjänster för både företag och privatpersoner.

### **Att arbeta på Hitta.se**


Hitta.se som arbetsplats kommer att ge dig fantastiska kollegor och spännande möjligheter. Vi strävar efter att leva efter våra kärnvärderingar; samarbete, innovation och kundfokus. På Hitta.se sätter vi våra människor och vår kultur i första rummet och för att vårda vårt teamwork tillämpar vi ett kontorsbaserat arbetssätt med möjlighet till remote-arbete två fasta dagar per vecka..  

  



### **Vill du vara en del av denna spännande resa?**


Känner du att just du passar in i beskrivningen ovan så är vi mycket intresserade av att komma i kontakt med dig. Ansök direkt via denna annons och skicka ditt CV och personliga brev till oss senast den 2025-09-07.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Junior software developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


Today we stand at the forefront of agile software development, using methods like Lean and Scrum to create a product that excels. Early customer and stakeholder feedback is a key element in our development process which is based on Continuous Integration SW practices. Our product, tools and infrastructure places high technical requirements on the team, including high-performance application development, low latency requirements, multi-threaded/multi-process troubleshooting, and embedded system development in an environment with huge amounts of data.

  

In the role of Software Developer, you will get the opportunity to work closely with your Product Owner and stakeholders in a collaborative environment, requiring both maturity and a strong ‘team first’ approach. Here, we embrace a culture of collective responsibility, ensuring that all tasks are completed according to the established backlog priority.  

To expand our organization’s capacity, we are looking for ambitious, intelligent, creative and inspiring individuals who are in the early stage of their career. We provide a dynamic, fun and challenging environment where you can grow and help to inspire your colleagues to further growth. With us, you’ll be joining a small cross-functional development team working with feature development.

 **Responsibilities & Tasks**


The team will design, implement and test the feature, product and system from requirements to production and commercial deployment. Each team has life cycle responsibility for a part of the product.  

Among other things, Unit/Component Test, Refactoring and Continuous Delivery are defining concepts and we are constantly improving our ways of working. We are not perfect and not afraid to say so. We are on a journey, and we know we have many problems to solve, and we need to learn new things on the way. We believe in trying new things connected to, e.g:

  

* Software Craftsmanship
* Analyze requirements and propose a software design
* Analyze verification needs and develop test cases validating your design
* Develop test case automation
* Execute tests, troubleshoot, and correct faults found
* Reserved time for improvements and innovations, Hackathons
* Knowledge sharing from external channels

 **Qualifications**

* MSc level in Computer Science or the equivalent level of knowledge
* 0 - 2 years of related experience in SW development
* Fluent in English, written and oral
* Skills in software development, preferably using Erlang, python or other functional languages

 **Meritorious qualifications**

* Experience from verification, troubleshoot and debug software issues to ensure optimal performance
* Experience of agile development and the Scrum framework.
* Knowledge of Git, Gerrit, Jenkins, HTTP2, TCP/IP, Linux, Containers
**The characteristics we hope to see in you**
---------------------------------------------



We are looking for a person who enjoys working with software and product development in an environment driven by close collaboration. We work together to reach and even exceed our goals and continuously strive to improve ourselves and our output. We believe that you with your structured and disciplined approach, are not just ready to learn but eager to tackle complex challenges and redefine the boundaries of innovation alongside your team. You can communicate in a clear and effective way. With a focus on solutions, you bring a can-do attitude to challenges, working well both independently and with the team.

 **Working at Ericsson**


Ericsson Packet Core products are at the core of the mobile network, connecting radio networks with the internet and enabling seamless connectivity. In our development unit, you’ll be part of the next step of our transformation: developing 5G networks with cloud native software for telecom operators around the world.


At Packet Core you’ll work with hundreds of talented developers, giving you plenty of opportunities to learn from senior colleagues and develop your own competence. We take pride in our commitment to innovation and regularly set aside time for Hackathons, allowing you to pursue your own ideas or work with new friends on the next big thing.


We’re next to Chalmers and the University of Gothenburg, with other cutting-edge tech companies as our closest neighbors in a buzzing area. There are plenty of opportunities for learning and networking at Lindholmen Science Park, and there is a wide range of restaurants for your  

convenience.

**Do you want to join a great team? Please send us your application today!**

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Göteborg

company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

title: Frontend Platform Developer
description:
**Join Our Team as a Frontend Platform Developer!**
---------------------------------------------------

#### **Are you passionate about creating stunning and interactive user interfaces? We're looking for a talented Frontend Developer to join our team and help us build the future of our platform!**

**Position Overview:**


As a Frontend Developer, you'll be responsible for crafting visually appealing designs and ensuring seamless functionality across various devices and browsers. Collaborate with a dynamic team of designers, back-end developers, and project managers to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Interface Development**: Create engaging front-end interfaces for our clients.
* **Design Collaboration**: Work with UI/UX designers to bring design mockups to life.
* **Code Excellence**: Write clean, modular, and maintainable code using HTML, CSS, TypeScript, and React.js.
* **Responsive Design**: Deliver responsive and visually appealing user interfaces.
* **Performance Optimization**: Optimize website performance for a seamless user experience.
* **Testing & Debugging**: Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure cross-browser compatibility.
* **Team Collaboration**: Work closely with the back-end development team for effective integration.
* **Innovation & Trends**: Stay up-to-date with the latest front-end development trends and propose innovative solutions.
* **Effective Communication**: Communicate effectively with team members, project managers, and stakeholders to ensure timely project delivery.

**Experience and Skills:**

* 4+ years of experience as a frontend developer.
* Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, TypeScript, and React.js.
* Experience with responsive design techniques and building mobile-friendly interfaces.
* Knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues and web performance optimization techniques.
* Understanding of UX/UI design principles and ability to collaborate effectively with designers.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

**Why Join Us?**


**Work from Anywhere**: Enjoy the flexibility of working from your preferred location, whether it's your home, a cozy café, or a sunny beach.


**Flexible Schedules**: Work when you're most productive with core hours that suit your lifestyle.


**Creative Freedom**: We trust your expertise—no micromanagement, just creativity and autonomy.


**Cutting-Edge Tools**: Access the latest hardware and software to help you excel in your role.


**Team Celebrations**: Join us for memorable team events and virtual hangouts that celebrate our remote team spirit.


Ready to make an impact and shape the future of our platform? Apply now and be part of our innovative journey!

title: Junior ML/AI Software Engineer
description:
**Frostbite** 
 is EA's proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of technologies designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine uniquely adapts to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline.
 



  





 As a
 **Machine Learning Software Engineer** 
 in the Frostbite Quality AI team, you will design machine learning systems that improve engineering efficiency for Frostbite and our games. You will collaborate with other software engineers, data engineers and quality analysts. You will report to the Senior Manager of Engine Development of Quality Engineering. Our team promotes a culture of learning, innovation and continuous improvement.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Design machine learning-based solutions to real-world software development workflow problems.
* Build end-to-end systems, including model evaluation, deployment, data collection, debugging, performance improvement, and monitoring.
* Collaborate with data engineers to design real-time data processing that allows dynamic context and improved inference.
* Write clean, well-documented, well-tested code that integrates smoothly with existing codebases.
* Stay up-to-date on advancements in deep learning and generative AI through self-study and internal and external conferences.
* Be an active member of EA's growing AI/ML community, communicating to partners, sharing knowledge, and mentoring other team members to develop their skills.



  





**Qualifications** 



* BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics, or equivalent experience.
* 2+ years of experience developing ML systems.
* Proficient in Python.
* Expertise in ML frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or MLFlow.
* Experience with large-scale machine learning, including big data and model deployment in distributed computing environments.
* Familiarity with the machine learning ecosystems of cloud providers (AWS, Azure).
* Proficiency in good software engineering practices (version control, unit testing, code reviews).



  





**Bonus if you have...** 



* Familiarity with software quality processes, test automation, or game development processes.

title: Backend Developer Intern (Remote)
company_industry: Software Development, IT System Custom Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering
 **machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions** 
 for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create
 **practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions** 
 that reshape industries.
 



 This internship offers a rare opportunity to
 **build backend systems that directly power advanced AR applications** 
 used in real-world industrial environments.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate, detail-oriented Backend Developer Intern** 
 with a strong interest in
 **API development, system integration, and backend architecture** 
 .
 



 This is a
 **remote, hands-on role** 
 where you will work closely with experienced developers to design, implement, and maintain backend services that support our AR platforms.
 



 While this is initially
 **unpaid** 
 , exceptional performance may lead to a
 **paid position** 
 after the internship.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Develop APIs** 
 : Build and maintain high-performance REST APIs using
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js** 
 .
* **Database Management** 
 : Work with
 **PostgreSQL** 
 and ORM tools (Sequelize) to design and optimize database schemas.

 : Write and run
 **unit and integration tests** 
 to ensure stability and performance.

 : Learn to work with
 **AWS cloud infrastructure** 
 and contribute to maintaining scalable, secure environments.
* **Troubleshooting & Maintenance** 
 : Help debug, patch, and optimize backend systems to improve reliability.
* **Code Reviews** 
 : Participate in peer reviews to maintain code quality and follow industry best practices.



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Proficiency in
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js**
* Solid
 **JavaScript** 
 &
 **TypeScript** 
 skills
* Experience with
 **PostgreSQL** 
 (basic to intermediate)
* Familiarity with
 **AWS services** 
 (some training provided)
* Understanding of
 **Git** 
 (we use Bitbucket)
* Basic knowledge of
 **CI/CD pipelines**
* Awareness of
 **IT security fundamentals**
* (Bonus) Experience with
 **Sequelize ORM**



  





**What You’ll Gain:** 



* Hands-on experience building backend systems for
 **real-world AR applications**
* Exposure to
 **AWS-based scalable architectures**
* Experience with
 **industrial-grade API design, testing, and security**
* Involvement in a
 **live product launch**



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is relatively broad and focused on backend technologies, where we offer the opportunity to work on many interesting projects on modern technologies.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer with a genuine enthusiasm in building robust solutions to power innovative digital experiences.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on a range of diverse and unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Backend Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Building high-performance backend systems using modern languages like Go, NodeJS, Python, and Kotlin to power innovative experiences
* Using modern backend frameworks such as Fiber, Ktor, Express and FastAPI to create robust solutions.
* Designing and implementing cloud-native solutions across AWS, GCP and Azure, using Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) for resource management
* Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines with containerized deployments and scaling strategies
* Developing robust data models and database architectures to support application requirements
* Participating in projects & teams alongside some of the largest and most forward-thinking brands on the planet


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


 Why Umain?
   

  

**Career Framework**
 We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
   

  

**Work-Life Balance**
 At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
   

  

**Innovations And Learning**
 Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
   

  

**Skills Over Degrees**
 We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.
   

  

 Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?
   

  

 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 (located in Gothenburg OR Stockholm).
   

  

 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate has an always-on mindset with a strong background in designing, configuring, and managing solutions for devices, tools, and applications in a factory/corporate setting.
   

  

 If you are a full-stack engineer looking to expand your skill set, we'd love to hear from you. Join our team today and take the next step in your career!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Understand and reflect on the customer needs to bring value to the organization.
* Take part in the development cycle using innovative technologies and frameworks.
* Secure qualitative, efficient and performance deliveries.
* Provide input for the design and construction of test cases and scenarios and help validate executed test results.
* Contribute to boosting the team to continually increase knowledge, competence, performance, and innovation
* Collaborate with suppliers, architects, engineers, developers, and internal stakeholders on upcoming and innovative technologies and standardization.
* Collaborate with the local IT site teams for problem/opportunity analysis.


**Qualifications**
* Hold a bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science or equivalent experience in a relevant field.
* Knowledge and experience in agile development practices, ITIL (incident, problem & change process), collaboration tools (such as Azure DevOps or similar)
* Java development & support, relational databases (Oracle, SQL server, My SQL).
* Eager to learn and grow (yourself and the company) using a modern approach to Software Engineering.
* Ability to work under rapidly changing conditions and have the capability to identify, mitigate and decide on solutions when facing obstacles.
* You are fluent in English, both verbally and written.
* You should have a general understanding of production processes and understand how all these things work together to make end user applications work well.
* Knowledge of the automotive industry is meritorious.


**Experience**
* Knowledge about databases (MS SQL (Azure))
* Development platforms (Java, OpenShift, ...)
* Azure Cloud (App services, AKS Azure Kubernetes Cluster)
* SQL server for database
* Azure Storage, Azure Container Services
* Frameworks (Spring, Springboot, WebFlux, ...)
* Messaging (MQ, Kafka, REST API, ...)
* Front-end (Angular)
* Test Driven Development (Unit testing in Spring Boot and Angular, in memory database testing using Mockito)
* Agile processes (Safe / Scrum / ADO) but also about backlog management, strategic planning, business relationship management, problem analysis and business modelling.
* Bonus points for having relevant experience using docker containers and orchestration with Kubernetes.


**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Collaborative working environment – we stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients and our peers through good times and challenges
* We empower all passionate technology loving professionals by allowing them to expand their skills and take part in inspiring projects
* Expleo Academy - enables you to acquire and develop the right skills by delivering a suite of accredited training courses
* Always working as one team, our people are not afraid to think big and challenge the status quo
* Collective agreement with the union
* Access to a collection of benefits and discounted prices on services and shops.
* Health benefits
* Expleo team activities


 "We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age ”.

title: Software Engineer (Optimizely, Stockholm)
description:
Har du ett intresse för att skapa tekniska lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad? Vill du vara med och skapa nästa generations teknik och bygga den digitala framtiden? Vi söker dig som vill bidra med din kompetens i projekt för några av världens största varumärken och som gärna håller dig uppdaterad inom .NET-utveckling och Optimizely.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Som .NET-utvecklare inom Optimizely/Episerver på Capgemini kommer du vara en del av ett agilt utvecklingsteam som arbetar med affärskritiska lösningar för våra kunder. Lösningarna nyttjar i största möjliga mån breda tekniska lösningar och tjänster i framkant från Microsoft och andra större partners. Detta innebär att du får en framtidssäkrad kompetens där du inte riskerar fastna i alltför specifika, smala och utdaterade lösningsområden.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i framkant gällande testdriven utveckling och clean coding. Du kommer delta i alla utvecklingsfaser, från kravanalys och design till utveckling, test och leverans. I rollen kommer du att fokusera på nyskapande projekt med möjlighet att jobba med kollegor i Sverige och i andra länder. Du rapporterar till en av våra teamchefer och utgår från vårt kontor på Fleminggatan i Stockholm.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Vi letar efter någon med minst 3 års .NET-erfarenhet, om följande tekniker låter intressanta för dig vill vi gärna höra från dig:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av Optimizely CMS (fd Episerver).
* Erfarenhet av C#, .NET Core och Azure.
* Azure Cloud, Kubernetes, Docker.
* Azure CI/CD pipelines.
* Service Bus, Rest APIs.
* Erfarenhet eller intresse för ytterligare relevanta tekniker och ramverk som tex: MS SQL Server, Angular, React, Vue, MVC .Net 6, WCAG2.2, Optimizely Commerce.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Föräldraförmån.
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden & Work-from-Home Policy.
* Guilds (Tech communities).
* Mentorskapsprogram (som mentor eller mentee).
* Delaktighet i Capgeminis olika fokusområden; Diversity and Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness club, Art club etc.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring & tjänstepension.
* Kompetensutveckling i form av utbildningar och certifieringar.


**Ansökan**
 Just nu har vi semesterperiod och hoppas att även du njuter av en fin sommar. Vi ser framemot att läsa igenom din ansökan när vi är tillbaka från semester och förväntar oss att kunna återkoppla dig mot slutet av augusti när vi är åter! Stort tack för ditt tålamod!
   

  

*Observera att identitets- och bakgrundskontroller kan genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.*
 Om Capgemini
   

  

 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: A talent Fullstack developer to Accounts & Retail Payments SE
company_industry: Banking, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
Are you a fullstack developer that is curious, highly skilled, dedicated, engaged, motivated and are looking for new challenges?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Design, develop, test, analyse and maintain our products and applications in Swedbank’s high tech services in Retail Payments & Accounts value stream.
* Cooperate with other agile team and engineers working on different layers in Swedbank.
* Maintain and make sure that our products and services are up and running 24/7.
* Create and deliver high quality code, by yourself and together with other developers.
* Build REST API Domain models.
* Collaborate with team members to build competence and relationships.
* Work close with competent, high skilled and technical experienced colleagues.
* Develop your skills and carrier in Swedbank.
* Enjoy your daily work and have fun.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* A team player who prioritizes the team’s goals.
* Understanding of agile processes (Scrum and SAFe).
* Interest of working both with new development and maintaining of existing systems, and even both with backend and frontend systems.
* Strong knowledge in Java (experience of working with Eclipse, RAD, InteliJ, Red Hat, Jenkins, Cloudbees, Git is preferable).
* Knowledge of building Micro services.
* Understanding of REST and SOAP service architecture and knowledge/experience of Java integration with mainframe (not mandatory, but preferable). Interested in unit-testing.
* Strong knowledge in Angular (understanding of NGRX is preferable).
* Also Openshift/Kubernetes knowledge is a big plus.
* Be open, Simple and Caring to build relationships in between the team, train and to other group/functions in Swedbank.
* Experience in Test: developing existing, building new and execute test cases(advantage if you can build automated test).
* Benefit is if you also have a passion about optimizing service performance and making them more faster and reliable.
* Relevant university degree.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 Ensure stability, compliance and meeting market demands for our Accounts & Payments related products & services for our private & corporate customers in Sweden. Our approach is to develop customer-facing functions to improve time-to-market products across the bank services for customers. Focus on re-designing, build and integrating a technology to support reliable, modularized and ready-to-use components.
   

  

 We are looking for a new great colleague to our fantastic team who will be a part of developing and maintaining the Accounts products and services to customers in Swedbank digital channel, Internet bank SE. "

**your future manager**

title: ServiceNow Developer for a leading IT Company in Sweden
company_industry: Software Development, IT System Custom Software Development, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**ServiceNow Developer for a leading IT Company in Sweden** 




  





*\*Please note that only Swedish-speaking candidates will be considered for the further interview process* 




  





 This reputable IT company is dedicated to modernizing the IT landscape for its clients, driving efficiency, agility, and innovation to achieve their digital ambitions. Serving large organizations across various industries and the public sector, they focus on ServiceNow as a leading IT Service Management platform within the market. Currently, they are seeking a skilled ServiceNow Developer to lead innovation and excellence within their team of developers.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Implement ServiceNow modules ITSM and HR for our customers.
* Able to implement integration using REST API or any other standard integration platforms available.
* Contribute as ServiceNow developer in projects ranging from simple to complex.
* Analyze and resolve production issues around implemented solution based on ServiceNow.
* Handle code migration from development to test to production instances of ServiceNow.
* Support end users with queries around ServiceNow based implemented solution.



  





  





**Requirements:** 



* Certified ServiceNow Administrator and preferably Certified Implementation Specialist in ITSM and CSM
* Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in ServiceNow developer working for clients
* Strong technical knowledge about on-premise ServiceNow ITSM and CSM module
* Candidates with strong experience in implementing ServiceNow native automation capabilities are preferred.
* Proven track record working in ServiceNow platform as technical consultant.Analyses and improves current implementation and solutions.



  





  





**As a person you are:** 



* Demonstrated ability to communicate well with customers and within organization
* Well-spoken, articulate and communicative
* Self-managed and well organized
* Natural ability to work in global environment and people



  





  





**Benefits:** 



* Growth-oriented work environment with mentorship and professional development opportunities
* Comprehensive health benefits including sports compensation, dental and vision coverage, healthy office snacks, sick leave compensation from the first day of absence, and company-covered doctor visits
* The hybrid work model and flexible working hours

title: AI Engineer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is ideal for engineers with demonstrable skills in AI as well as for software engineers who have recently transitioned to AI and ML expertise, and offers an opportunity to develop your craft whilst working closely with clients on delivering AI solutions to real-world challenges.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are seeking an AI Engineer with a strong intuition for AI and a genuine enthusiasm in building robust, scalable solutions to power innovative digital experiences. The ideal candidate combines technical expertise with a deep enthusiasm for advancing AI capabilities.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work closely with global brands on a range of diverse and unique projects that explore and truly push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As an AI Engineer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Assisting our clients in clarifying their questions and determining if using AI is a suitable solution for them
* You understand the limitations of a model and how to address them within the product’s UX
* Implementing AI-as-a-Service (e.g., OpenAI, Claude LLMs) in projects; you assess when these services are a good option and understand any potential limitations
* Being familiar with pre-trained models and available datasets and the ability to apply them if existing AI services fall short for the use case at hand
* Validating, deploying, monitoring, and maintaining built models, ensuring they can be used at scale
* Developing and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines and machine learning workflows, optimizing for performance and reliability
* Working with diverse, cross-functional teams on projects that deliver groundbreaking AI solutions for global brands


 It’s a plus (not a requirement) if you have additional experience in:
   

  

* PyTorch, Tensorflow
* Transfer learning, few-shot learning, PEFT and LoRa
* Multi-modal transformer models, RLHF


 Who You Are
   

  

**We Value Candidates Who Demonstrate**
* Great delivery skills: Proven capability to deliver AI solutions
* Strong AI intuition: A deep understanding of AI concepts
* Curiosity: Enthusiasm for emerging technologies, creativity in problem-solving, and an eagerness to learn in a rapidly evolving AI landscape
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


**Why Umain?**
**Career Framework** 
 : We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
   

  

**Work-Life Balance** 
 : At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
   

  

**Innovations and Learning** 
 : Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
   

  

**Skills Over Degrees** 
 : We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.
   

  

 Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?
   

  

 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Java Developer at Thermo-Calc Software
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you ready to take a key role in a growing and innovative tech company with a global reach? Thermo-Calc Software in Solna is looking for a passionate Java Developer to join our mission of developing the next generation of advanced applications in materials science. Here, you'll collaborate with researchers and engineers in a dynamic environment where your code truly matters — all over the world.
   

  

 We offer a workplace where technology, curiosity, and collaboration go hand in hand. You’ll be part of a team developing high-performance solutions for materials calculations, supporting industries and research institutions in understanding and predicting material behavior. Help us shape the Future of Materials Science!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Java Developer at Thermo-Calc Software, you'll play a central role in the development and maintenance of our sophisticated desktop application, primarily using Java with a strong focus on the graphical user interface built in Swing. You’ll also be involved in shaping our next-generation web-based platform, working closely with frontend and FORTRAN developers using a modern tech stack that includes React, TypeScript, Fastify, Spring Boot, and Azure.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll write clean, efficient, and well-documented code, while continuously collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to define and implement new features. Your keen eye for detail and performance will be crucial as you troubleshoot and fine-tune application functionality to ensure a seamless user experience.
   

  

 You'll be part of a team that values code quality and collective ownership — participating in code reviews and contributing to high engineering standards. Staying current with the latest technologies and best practices in Java development is part of your mindset, and you'll apply this knowledge to build secure, scalable, and reliable software solutions that make a real impact.
   

  

 You will work in a broad role and be involved in areas such as:
   

  

* Develop and maintain our comprehensive Java-based desktop application, with a strong focus on the graphical user interface (Swing)
* Contribute to the development of our next-generation web-based platform alongside frontend and FORTRAN developers
* Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code
* Collaborate closely with team members and stakeholders to define and implement new features
* Troubleshoot and optimize application performance
* Participate in code reviews and help maintain high technical standards across the team
* Stay up to date with modern technologies, tools, and best practices in Java development


 Ensure the security, scalability, and reliability of our software solutions.Selection is ongoing, so please submit your application as soon as possible. We are collaborating with Randstad Digital for this recruitment. If you have any questions about the position or the process, you are welcome to contact Julia Rhönnstad at julia.rhonnstad@randstad.se. Welcome to a workplace where you can truly make a difference.
   

  

 Welcome to a workplace where your code truly matters.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Solid experience with Java and traditional GUI frameworks (such as Swing or JavaFX)
* Strong skills in object-oriented programming and design patterns
* Experience with large and long-living monolithic applications
* Experience building user-friendly and responsive interfaces
* Ability to write clean, maintainable, and efficient code
* Proficiency with version control tools such as Git
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
* A degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.


**Meritorious**
* Experience in web development (e.g. React, TypeScript, Fastify, Spring Boot)
* Familiarity with Windows, Linux and macOS development environments
* Interest in science or engineering-related technology

title: Data & Cloud Systems Developer
description:
**Who We Are** 




 At EVEWAVE, we’re rethinking global logistics towards zero-waste systems. Our reusable, modular pallet units replace single-use packaging, improving safety, efficiency, and sustainability across the supply chain. Our embedded sensors deliver real-time data, and a modular design give companies complete transparency and control over how goods move. The intelligence behind this platform lives in the cloud - and that’s where you come in.
 



  





**Why This Role Matters** 




 As our Data & Cloud Systems Developer, you’ll architect the systems that turn raw data into actionable insights. From building secure data pipelines to enabling predictive analytics, your work will be the nervous system of our zero-waste logistics solution.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Build backend services for receiving, storing, and processing pallet data
* Design the data pipeline from device → gateway → cloud → analytics dashboard
* Create baseline models to track performance and detect anomalies
* Prepare infrastructure for our future AI layer - the “Fitbit for Supply Chain” optimization engine



  





**What You Bring** 



* Background in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or related field
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS IoT Core, Azure IoT, or GCP IoT)
* Strong database design skills (SQL + NoSQL) and data visualization (Grafana, PowerBI)
* Basic ML pipeline knowledge for anomaly detection and optimization



  





**Our Hiring Process** 




 We know your time is valuable, so here’s what to expect:
 


* Application Deadline: September 10th (we review applications as they come in and may hire earlier)
* First Round: Conversation + take-home case to understand your working style and team fit
* Next Steps: Follow-up interview to dive deeper into your skills, experience, and how we can build something great together



  





 We’re looking for curious, thoughtful and ambitious people who enjoy solving real challenges and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
 



  





 If that sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.
 



 Please don't hesitate to reach out to cp@evewave.com if you have any questions.
 



  





 📍
 **Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Java developer
description:
*Digpro är en stor innovatör inom geografisk IT och även marknadsledande i Skandinavien. Vi tillhandahåller lösningar för el, telekom, gas, fjärrvärme, vatten samt stat och kommuner - i själva verket alla organisationer som bygger och underhåller olika sorters nät. Vi är fler än 100 anställda på tre olika kontor, där alla arbetar på ett unikt sätt för att göra geografiska data och kartsystem mer flexibla och effektiva.*
**The Digpro mission is to be the compass for smart society infrastructure and to support our customers in their aim to maximize the knowledge and control of their network. To succeed in this mission an understanding of the customer needs and the tools we develop is crucial. Our belief that diversity inspires innovation guides us in our development routines as well as in our recruitment process. Our values bring us together and help us in our efforts to contribute to stronger and more durable utilities and societies in the future.**
**We are searching for a java developer to join our team at Digpro’s headquarters in Stockholm. We’re expanding to new markets and investing more than ever in our products – we need your help to succeed. Our products support essential public services and have a long life span which requires high quality and a special focus on the maintainability of the code.**
**About The Job**
 As a java developer at Digpro you are part of a team dedicated to develop and maintain the products and modules assigned to the team. You work closely together with other developers and collaborate with other roles such as product owners, UX-designers, testers and technical writers.
   

  

 Your day to day work will include programming, time estimations, designing technical solutions, code review and technical documentation. Digpro is a growing company, aiming to find scalable solutions for both products and processes, you will be a part of this exciting transformation.
   

  

 As you gain experience in our technical stack, architecture and our products, you will also gain responsibilities within technical areas of the code and applications as well as responsibilities in mentoring junior colleagues.
   

  

 You will
   

  

* Be developing and maintaining systems for important societal functions
* Create integrations with other systems
* Be part of a supporting and inventive team
* Perform time estimations for development tasks
* Do code reviews and automated unit tests
* Write technical documentation and “Howtos”
* Demonstrate developed features
* Be part of the third line technical support


**We Are Looking For You Who Have**
* A curious and positive attitude
* A relevant education in computer science.
* Good knowledge in Java and SQL
* Experience of Java Swing is an advantage
* Good theoretical foundation in your programming skills
* Analytics skills and knowledge of algorithms and data structures
* An open mind regarding new ideas, needs, requirements and opportunities in a changing world
* Interest in constructive discussions regarding opportunities and solutions together with several different stakeholders


**What We Offer**
 At Digpro, you will get the opportunity to build a meaningful career with meaningful products. No matter your role, you will be a part of a highly professional and welcoming team.
   

  

 We are an established tech company with a startup spirit. What does this mean? Well, we have a lot in common with tech startups: we love complex programming, we play ping-pong during breaks, and we all help shape our company culture as it evolves. But we also offer something extra you don’t always find at startups - stability. Our processes are in place, experienced colleagues are at hand when you need advice, and we all appreciate a good traditional Swedish “fika”.
   

  

 For the role, probationary employment is applied. To give you the best possible onboarding, both socially and professionally, we would like to recommend working on-site as much as possible. This is in our bright and airy office at Kungsholmen in Stockholm.
   

  

 The role may involve work on projects that require security clearance from the Swedish Security Service / SÄPO.
   

  

 You are welcome to send in your application with CV and personal letter by clicking on the ad or via our career page at Digpro.com.
   

  

 Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Start date: Autumn 2025

title: SQL Database Developer
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



  





 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As our Database Developer at Xensam, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the performance, integrity, and security of our company's databases. You will work closely with our development and operations teams, providing support and guidance to optimize our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, as well as implementing efficient data models.
 



  





 The ideal candidate is passionate about database management, possesses at least 3-5 years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, and thrives in an environment that values freedom of work and the ability to get things done.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 You will take ownership by maintaining and managing our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, performing routine database administration tasks, such as database monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimization. You will also collaborate with development and operations teams to design and implement efficient database structures and schemas. Other responsibilities that you will have:
 


* Engage in database concept refinement, data modeling, and the fine-tuning of SQL queries for optimal system performance.
* Monitor database performance and proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
* Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues, including query optimization and data consistency problems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enforce database standards and best practices.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in SQL and database administration.



  





**Qualifications** 



* 3-5 years of professional experience working with databases.
* Strong proficiency in SQL/PostgreSQL database administration and performance tuning.
* Excellent understanding of database concepts, data modeling, and SQL query optimization.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex database-related issues.
* Proven ability to work independently, take ownership of projects, and meet deadlines.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* **Strong proficiency in written and spoken English.**



  





**Bonus points for** 



* SQL/PostgreSQL certification (e.g., SQL/PostgreSQL Certified Professional) is a plus.
* Experience with other database technologies, such as Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle Database, MongoDB etc.
* Experience in the field of software licensing generally, or Software Asset Management specifically.



  





**What You Get** 



* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* A generous work culture with free access to drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* Other location-specific benefits.



  





**At Xensam, Our Core Values Define Our Culture** 




**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
 



**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
 



  





 Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive,
 **APPLY now!** 




  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.
