title: Fullstack utvecklare Telenor
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Är du en nyfiken fullstack-utvecklare som vill jobba i en teknikdriven miljö och göra skillnad för hundratusentals aktiva användare? Vimla är mobiloperatören, som genom att vara en fristående del av Telenor, kombinerar kraften från en stor organisation med friheten och flexibiliteten i ett litet team. Vi står för att ta kundfokus, enkelhet och schyssthet till en ny nivå på mobilmarknaden och i vårt team. Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt och roligt att vara kund så väl som medarbetare hos oss!
   

  

 Nu har du chansen att joina teamet i rollen som Senior fullstack utvecklare, ta chansen och sök!
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra**
 I rollen som Senior Fullstack utvecklare på Vimla kommer du in i en scale-up miljö där du tillsammans med ditt team arbetar i syfte att utveckla och underhålla Vimlas tekniska miljö. Ni står i centrum för att bygga de tekniska förutsättningarna för en helt digital mobiloperatör. Du arbetar tillsammans med ett tight team av utvecklare med passion för teknik och bra stämning. Teamet består av såväl juniora som mer seniora kollegor, vilket medför en kultur av lärande och kunskapsdelning.
   

  

 Inom ramen för rollen kommer du
   

  

* Bygga och optimera våra API:er
* Förbättra vår CI/CD-pipeline
* Utveckla nya tjänster i vår digitala plattform
* Jobba med skalbarhet i vår molnbaserade miljö


 Hos oss får du möjlighet att utmanas, utveckla din kompetens och arbeta med fantastiska och kompetenta kollegor. Om du gillar att ha en möjlighet att påverka vad du jobbar med, en bredd i dina arbetsuppgifter och jobba i ett tight DevOps-team - det här är platsen för dig!
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
 Vi ser att du har minst tre års tidigare erfarenheter av utveckling inom Typescript, node backends samt react för frontend. Du har fokus på leverans och säkerställer alltid god kvalitet i slutresultatet och tror att du tidigare har erfarenhet från att designa, bygga och underhålla distribuerade system i en molnbaserad miljö (tex AWS). Vi förutsätter att du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska.
   

  

 Tech-stack du jobbar med:
   

  

* Frontend: React, TypeScript, Redux, Jest, Playwright & React Native
* Backend: Node.js, API-utveckling
* Databas: PostgreSQL
* Arbetssätt: Agilt, DevOps, testdriven utveckling (TDD)


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Svelte
* Nginx, shell-scripting (Bash, Nushell)
* QA-arbete
* DevOps & Infrastruktur: Docker, Kubernetes/Docker Swarm, AWS, CI/CD med GitHub Actions


 På Vimla så värdesätter vi individer som är angelägna om att lära sig och utveckla sin egen kompetens. Vi förväntar oss inte att du känner till alla teknologier i vår stack, så vi letar främst efter någon med ett tillväxttänk och en vilja att lära sig!
   

  

**Varför du vill jobba på Vimla**
 Vimla är på en spännande tillväxtresa och möjligheterna att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss är enorma. Vi är ett roligt, tight team på runt 40 personer i en egen organisation som har stor frihet. Samtidigt är Vimla en del av Telenor Sverige och använder tryggheten som finns i ett stort bolag.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Vimla/Telenor med Experis IT, som har lång erfarenhet av att rekrytera IT-specialister och chefer.
   

  

 Om du har frågor eller vill ha mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsulterna Anki Snis på
 **anki.snis@se.experis.com** 
 , +46 70-377 59 69, och Carina Eyoma på
 **carina.eyoma@se.experis.com** 
 , +46 73-086 22 75.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan!
   

  

 I enlighet med Telenors policy genomför vi en bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidater i alla rekryteringar.
   

  

 Plats: Stockholm Råsunda

title: Business Developer
description:
Intric is accelerating its growth, driven by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform - Intric.ai - is currently transforming how work is done, primarily within the public sector and companies that value data sovereignty, by making the power of AI accessible to a wider audience. We have secured a market-leading position in a niche of this segment.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual eager to embark on the journey of a lifetime with our expanding and driven team.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Business Developer you are at the core of the sales team, helping accelerating our growth by expanding the use of our platform to new customers.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Passionate about business development and interested in AI
* Solution-oriented with an entrepreneurial spirit who gets things done
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, agile environment
* We think you have 1-2 years of experience in similar roles or demonstrable achievements in relevant areas. Experience with a startup is considered extra relevant.
* Fluent in Swedish, social, driven, and eager to learn new things
* Proficiency in especially Norwegian or German, but other European languages as well is considered a strong plus (not a requirement but highly valued).


**Key Responsibilities**
 As a part of our sales team, one of your primary responsibilities is to bring our revolutionary product to both new and existing markets. This will include executing activities such as:
   

  

* Talking to potential customers and understand their needs
* Negotiating and closing deals
* Sourcing and initiating potential partnership opportunities
* Do what it takes to hit targets and deadlines, which might include proactive demand generation and finding creative ways to build the sales pipeline


**What We Offer**
* An opportunity to be a part of building a system and company that defines the future
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options

title: Fullstack-utvecklare
description:
Till HiQ söker vi nu erfarna Fullstack-utvecklare som vill vara med och skapa innovativa och användarvänliga lösningar för våra kunder. I rollen kommer du fokusera på backend-utveckling och bidra till projekt som gör skillnad för samhället. Du blir en viktig del av ett kompetent team där ni tillsammans hanterar utvecklingen av framtidens digitala tjänster.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som Fullstack-utvecklare kommer du främst att arbeta med backend-utveckling, men även ha möjlighet att bidra med frontend-kompetens när det behövs. Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Backend: Java (Spring, Spring Boot) eller .NET/C#
* Frontend: Javascript/Typescript (React.js, Vue.js eller Angular)
* Molnlösningar: AWS, GCP eller Azure


 Du kommer att delta i hela utvecklingsprocessen från design och utveckling till test och driftsättning, samt bidra med tekniskt innovativa lösningar.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av fullstack-utveckling
* Ingenjörsexamen i datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande
* Svenskt medborgarskap och är flytande i svenska och engelska


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes och CI/CD-pipelines
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar (AWS, Azure, GCP)


**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Utmanande uppdrag både ute i våra kunders organisationer samt i vår egen regi, där HiQ har helhetsansvar för projekten.
* Möjlighet att delta i och leda utvecklingen av våra kunders framtida tjänster som förenklar människors vardag
* Kunniga kollegor som gärna delar med sig av sina kunskaper och erfarenheter
* En kreativ arbetsmiljö med möjlighet att utvecklas som människa, kollega och bli bättre på det du redan är bäst på!
* Du blir en del av ett värderingsstyrt bolag som värdesätter glädje och gemenskap och hittar på mycket roligt tillsammans.


**Varför HiQ**
 Sedan 1995 har HiQ varit konsultbolaget som förenklat världen för både kunder och slutanvändare med hjälp av teknik, design och kommunikation. HiQ har alltid fokuserat på två saker: att ha kul på jobbet och att leverera lösningar utöver förväntningar - det är vad som driver oss framåt! Vi HiQare är stolta över att ha en kultur som präglas av
 **resultat** 
 ,
 **ansvar, enkelhet** 
 och
 **glädje** 
 . Vi tror på att arbeta tillsammans för att nå våra gemensamma mål och strävar efter att hjälpa varandra att fortsätta växa och utvecklas. Hos oss får du utöver chansen att utveckla din egen kompetens också möjlighet att lära, leda och inspirera dina kollegor.
   

  

*I denna rekrytering tillämpar vi löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå urvalsfrågor, intervjuer, tekniska tester, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*

title: Senior Software Engineer
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Engineering
company_industry: Energy Technology, Services for Renewable Energy, and Data Infrastructure and Analytics
description:
Optimization and Control Engineer, Clevry, Espoo
 



  





**We are looking for** 




 Clevry is seeking an
 **Optimization and Control Engineer** 
 for our client company, based at their office in Espoo or Stockholm. This is a full-time, permanent position, with employment through Clevry. The role will begin as soon as the right candidate is found, ideally in August or early autumn. We will share more details about the client company during the first stage of the recruitment process.
 



 In this role, you’ll join a team dedicated to shaping the future of clean energy. You’ll have the opportunity to be at the forefront of innovation by developing efficient optimization and control solutions that align with customer needs and market regulations. You will work alongside a talented group of senior and junior specialists—including designers, developers, data scientists, and testers, playing a key role in the company’s ambitious digitalization and AI journey.
 



 We believe you are the ideal candidate if you are passionate about innovation and have a strong background in engineering and computer science.
 



 Please note that the selected candidate must complete a background check and health examination, which may include a drug test.
 



**Main tasks** 



* Developing scalable forecasting, optimization, and steering algorithms
* Creating aggregation methods for scalability
* Designing tractable approximations when necessary
* Collaborating with backend and frontend teams on interfaces
* Supporting data scientists and ML engineers
* Learning about power system stability and testing requirements
* Coaching the team on system stability, tractability, and performance



**We expect** 



* A master's degree in computer science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience
* Over 4 years of experience in stochastic control and optimization
* More than 3 years of solid software engineering experience, preferably in Python
* At least 2 years of experience working with cloud solutions, especially AWS
* Knowledgeable in statistics and data science with at least 1 year of hands-on experience
* Familiarity with GitHub Actions service deployment, containers, and DevOps practices
* A firm grasp of software engineering principles such as SOLID and clean code
* Excellent communication skills and a keen interest in the energy sector
* Full professional proficiency in written and spoken English



 It will be considered an advantage if you have experience with machine learning and generative AI, EV chargers or home energy systems, forecast models, and data engineering. Familiarity with IT security, data storage, microservice architecture, OCPP, MQTT, IoT devices, and Agile ways of working is also valued.
 



**We offer you** 



* The opportunity to shape a more sustainable future with a meaningful job
* A safe and supportive work environment – both physically and mentally
* Trust, autonomy, and professional growth alongside skilled colleagues
* Comprehensive benefits to support your wellbeing
* Flexible working hours and a hybrid work model
* A culture that values diversity, inclusion, and equal treatment for all



**Apply now!** 




 If you recognize yourself in this description, please apply for the position by 11.8.2025. However, we urge you to act quickly – we will proceed with potential candidates already during the application period. Please note that we cannot receive applications via email due to data privacy legislation and that we handle all inquiries on behalf of our client company. For more information about the position, you can contact Clevry's Head of Recruitment, Tiia Mäenpää (tiia.maenpaa@clevry.com).
 



**Additional information about our recruitment process** 




 At Clevry, we believe that rather than focusing solely on hard skills, the key to success is based on soft skills and the willpower to rise beyond expectations. Therefore, our recruitment process involves psychometric assessments that evaluate soft skills and cognitive abilities essential for each role. By assessing soft skills, we can help applicants describe their strengths more effectively and find employment quicker and more easily. When applying through us, you will receive a personal feedback report based on the personality assessment. The recruitment process also involves an interview with both Clevry and the client company, so you will get to know both as the recruitment process progresses.
 



**Additional information about Clevry** 




 For over 30 years we have been the change-maker for more soft skills-driven working life within talent acquisition, assessments, and advisory. We operate globally with customers, consultants, and candidates from North America to Singapore with headquarters in Brighton, Stockholm, and Helsinki. At Clevry we have over 150 soft skills certified recruiters, business psychologists, and experts at your service. We find the right candidate for the job and the right job for the candidate!

title: C++ Developer
description:
HiQ samarbetar idag med teknikintensiva kunder i framkant som produktbolag inom industrin, försvar och autonoma fordon. Det kan handla om förarlösa tåg eller elektrifierade tunga lastbilar samt sensor och navigationssystem för både båtar och flyg. Vi är involverade i utvecklingen av både komponenterna i fordonen och de som finns vid sidan av dem. En del av projekten har en internationell omfattning med hög säkerhetsklassning.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som gillar att grotta ner dig i komplexa problem. Vi tror att det är bäst för helheten i projektet om du är trygg i din kompetens och har några års erfarenhet med dig in i rollen.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Högskole-/Civilingenjörsexamen inom datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling inom C++.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Möjlighet att jobba på plats på kontoret 3-5 dagar i veckan.
* Erfarenhet eller intresse för industribranschen.


**Varför HiQ**
 Sedan 1995 har HiQ varit konsultbolaget som förenklat världen för både kunder och slutanvändare med hjälp av teknik, design och kommunikation. HiQ har alltid fokuserat på två saker: att ha kul på jobbet och att leverera lösningar utöver förväntningar - det är vad som driver oss framåt! Vi HiQare är stolta över att ha en kultur som präglas av
 **resultat** 
 ,
 **ansvar, enkelhet** 
 och
 **glädje** 
 . Vi tror på att arbeta tillsammans för att nå våra gemensamma mål och strävar efter att hjälpa varandra att fortsätta växa och utvecklas. Hos oss får du utöver chansen att utveckla din egen kompetens också möjlighet att lära, leda och inspirera dina kollegor.
   

  

*I denna rekrytering tillämpar vi löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*

title: Senior Frontend Developer till IT Customer and accounts
description:
**I rollen får du:** 




 • Skapa värde för våra produkter och kunder.
 



 • Jobba med fantastiska medarbetare i en lärande och utvecklande miljö.
 



 • Flexibelt arbete och balans i livet.
 



  





 Vi söker nu en frontend-utvecklare till IT customer and accounts. Teamet jobbar med centrala applikationer i ATG:s miljö inom områdena payment, responsible gambling och anti money laundry, så det är en fördel om du trivs med att jobba i komplexa och transaktionstunga miljöer. Gör du det så välkomnas du till ett team som har kul tillsammans och som tror på öppenhet och transparens i arbetet. Vi jobbar blandat på kontoret och hemifrån, men har daglig kontakt i teamet och samarbetar även tvärfunktionellt med andra team inom IT.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och för att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du som söker har flera års arbetslivserfarenhet inom frontend-utveckling. Vidare ser vi att du är nyfiken, prestigelös och gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap. Det är viktigt att du är en teamspelare som har en god samarbetsförmåga. Du bör även ha en god kommunikativ förmåga på både engelska och svenska. Meriterande är om du har erfarenhet av och intresse för backend-utveckling samt app-utveckling och eventuellt vill gå mot att bli fullstack-utvecklare på sikt. För att lyckas i denna roll ser vi att du känner till arbete med agila metoder och värdesätter teamarbete men även eget ansvar. Vidare ser vi att du gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om och är nyfiken på att lära dig nya tekniska lösningar.
 



  





 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av:
 



 • React
 



 • Typescript
 



 • Redux
 



 • Redux Saga
 



 • HTML
 



 • CSS
 



 • React Native
 



 • (GraphQL)
 



  





 Meriterande:
 



 • AWS
 



 • Microfrontend
 



 • Playwright
 



  





**"För mig är det bästa med ATG att det är en otroligt inkluderande arbetsplats. Ett brett samarbete och en närvarande och synlig ledning som bryr sig om och lyssnar till sina medarbetare”** 




 Jag är en engagerad ledare som drivs av att se människor och organisationer utvecklas. Jag litar på mina medarbetare fullt ut. De är experterna, och jag finns där för att stötta och skapa så bra förutsättningar som möjligt för att alla ska kunna göra ett bra jobb och trivas på arbetsplatsen. Jag har arbetat med IT sen början av 00-talet, men är själv inte tekniskt utbildad, istället finns mina styrkor i ledarskapet och organisationsutvecklingen. För mig är det bästa med ATG att det är en otroligt inkluderande arbetsplats. Ett brett samarbete och en närvarande och synlig ledning som bryr sig om och lyssnar till sina medarbetare.
 



**- Lisa Oldmar, Manager IT Customer and Accounts.** 




  





**Med anledning av sommarsemester kommer vi att återuppta arbetet med ansökningarna under v.33.** 




  





**We are the game** 




 I mer än 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
 



  





**Join the game!** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
 



 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och kommer att göra en bakgrundskontroll för denna roll. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!

title: Azure Developer
description:
Join Dustin’s integration team and take charge of driving innovation as you work with cutting-edge Azure technologies to shape the future of our cloud solutions. If you're well experienced in the field, passionate about Azure, integrations, and making an impact through technology, this is the opportunity for you.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Azure Developer unique**
* Drive innovation with the latest Azure technologies in a key role shaping Dustin’s cloud-first transformation.
* Take the lead and inspire others by coaching and sharing your expertise within integrations and modern cloud architecture.
* Unleash your creativity in a tech-driven team where your ideas and initiatives truly make an impact.


 The hiring manager for the role is
 **Sara Wennerström, Director of Application Management.** 
 She believes that successful work is built on initiative, engagement, and a solid understanding of business processes and system support. As a leader, she is open, attentive, and committed to setting goals together with the team to achieve collective success.
   

  

 The integration development team is close-knit, where members consistently support one another, balancing focused work time from home with two fixed office days each week, dedicated to collaboration and enjoying early lunches together.
   

  

****Read more about Dustin here****
**Your role & influence as Azure Developer**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for integration development in Azure, including designing solution architectures for new requirements and driving process improvements as an informal leader within the team.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of integration development between standard applications, build APIs for external customers, and continuously maintain and improve the team’s solutions. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with other developers across Technology and a wide range of internal and external stakeholders around Dustin.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Develop and implement integration solutions using Azure technologies like Logic Apps, Azure Functions, and Service Bus.
* Design solution architectures for new integration requirements and recommend the best technical approaches.
* Collaborate with the team to maintain and improve existing BizTalk solutions, while coaching and sharing knowledge with colleagues in the Azure and integration space.


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more on our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual passionate about cutting-edge technology, eager to lead and mentor, and skilled at driving innovative solutions. We expect that you bring solid senior experience in Azure Functions, Logic Apps, Service Bus, and Cosmos DB, with a strong background in leading teams, implementing new processes, and solution architecture.
   

  

**Additionally, It'll Be Nice If You Bring**
* A bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* Experience with APIM, Biztalk
* Proficiency in Swedish.


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu.
* First interview with the Hiring Manager, Sara Wennerström.
* Technical (Second) interview with two future colleagues from the team.
* Professional References.


***Please note that for this specific job, we don´t provide any relocation or work permit sponsorship support. Due to summer holidays, please expect a delay in the response from us.***
**About**
**Read more about how to become a** 
**Dustineer**
 For questions about the position, please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu via e-mail: karishma.sindhu@dustin.com
 **.**

title: C++/Rust Graphics and Windowing System Software Engineer - Mir
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **C++/Rust Graphics and Windowing System Software Engineer.**
 We build Mir – a high-performance, high-efficiency technology stack for window managers, display subsystems and solutions built on top of it, like Ubuntu Frame. Leading with vision, we shape the technology stack that empowers communities to realize a world where apps work seamlessly in every graphical environment.
   

  

 Our goal is to enable the whole spectrum of graphics from single-purpose screens through edge devices to full desktop environments. We also set the pace for graphics enablement across the Ubuntu certified hardware ecosystem. Our daily drill includes design, development and testing of features as well as working with the community and responding to issues and user inquiries.
   

  

 Most of the software is written in C++, with support tooling in scripting languages. We will use Rust as an evolutionary step forward. Thus candidates are required to have strong skills in both Rust and C++. We're growing the team and looking for new colleagues who share our passion for precision, performance and user experience. We are hiring on various career levels with a minimum of 2 years industry experience. We are looking for people who ideally have experience in building window compositing systems or graphics device experience. We're committed to creating an outstanding developer experience, secure foundations, and easy access to today's most used graphics toolkits and libraries.
   

  

 This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern display technologies that will impact millions of developers and users. Canonical offers a fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development opportunities across the open source spectrum.
   

  

 Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA or APAC region.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Design and implementation of features across the Mir stack
* Assisting in debugging, tracking down and fixing issues
* Participating in our engineering process through code and architectural review
* Creating and improving tests and performance benchmarks to catch issues early
* Creating and maintaining documentation to enhance the developer experience
* Engaging with the open source community and commercial partners
* Collaborating proactively with a distributed team


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Excellent Bachelor's or equivalent degree in Computer Science, STEM or similar and 2+ years of working experience
* Excellent modern C++ and excellent Rust programming skills
* Familiarity with Linux as a development and deployment platform
* Ability to collaborate remotely with a diverse set of team members and remain highly motivated, productive, and organized
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year for company events up to two weeks long


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* You have experience with the Wayland protocol ecosystem and compositors
* You are familiar with OpenGL, Vulkan, Flutter and other graphics, toolkits and animation frameworks
* You have a solid understanding of asynchronous programming and concurrency patterns
* You have proven ability to consistently deliver robust code to production
* You have strong written and verbal communication skills to document and present software developed


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
   

  

 #Graphics #OpenSource #Canonical #Mir #Rust #C++

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga en modern DevOps-miljö för framtidens bank- och försäkringslösningar? Vi söker en senior DevOps Engineer som vill vara drivande i att utveckla vår leveransplattform och våra molnlösningar – i en organisation där teknik, kultur och kundvärde går hand i hand.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Rollen som DevOps Engineer är central i vår produktutveckling där fokus ligger på att effektivisera, automatisera och skala upp vår tekniska leveransförmåga. Du kommer att arbeta på en plattform där utvecklingsteam snabbt och säkert kan bygga, testa, deploya och övervaka applikationer genom välstrukturerade pipelines och self-service-lösningar.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Etablera och vidareutveckla vår Internal Developer Platform (IDP)
* Automatisera hela utvecklingsflödet genom CI/CD-pipelines, releasehantering och deployment-strategier
* Samarbeta med produktteam, säkerhet, drift och arkitekter för att driva DevOps-praxis i hela utvecklingskedjan
* Designa och implementera robusta DevOps-lösningar i Azure Cloud (primär plattform) – AWS är meriterande
* Integrera säkerhet och regelefterlevnad-förmågor i leveranskedjan (Shift Left & DevSecOps)
* Bidra till vision, strategi och roadmap för vår gemensamma utvecklingsplattform
* Delta i tekniska communitys och kunskapsdelning över team och ARTs


 Du arbetar agilt i en organisation som tillämpar SAFe i stor skala, och du blir en viktig del i att bygga en skalbar, resilient och produktiv DevOps-miljö.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är en tekniskt stark och nyfiken och brinner för automation, struktur och utvecklarupplevelse. Du har ett holistiskt tänk kring plattform och värdeskapande utveckling, och du trivs i en roll där du får kombinera teknik med samarbete, strategi och förbättringsarbete. Du är en doer med struktur och integritet – och en naturlig lagspelare i agila team.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Minst 10 års erfarenhet inom DevOps, systemutveckling eller plattformsutveckling
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Azure Cloud, containerplattformar som OpenShift/Kubernetes/Docker
* Djup förståelse för CI/CD-principer, infrastrukturautomatisering och pipelineförmågor
* Erfarenhet av att bygga eller arbeta med Internal Developer Platforms (IDP)
* Förmåga att skapa self-service-funktionalitet och stödja developer experience
* Kunskap inom Infrastructure as Code (IaC) med t.ex. Terraform, ARM/Bicep eller liknande
* Förståelse för säkerhetsaspekter i DevOps (t.ex. hemlighetshantering, SAST/DAST, policy enforcement)
* Erfarenhet av arbete i agila ramverk, gärna SAFe
* Hög teknisk kommunikationsförmåga – du kan både förenkla och fördjupa beroende på målgrupp
* Grundläggande förståelse för svenska och engelska i tal och skrift och en ambition att ständigt utvecklas


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av AWS och hybrid cloud-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av observability-verktyg och metricsbaserad utveckling
* Kunskap inom GitOps, eventdriven arkitektur och serverless
* Erfarenhet från plattformsdriven utveckling i större organisationer


**Om oss**
 Process and Dev Tools är en del av Digital Solution & Operation Platform, DSOP inom vår IT-organisation Digital & IT. Vi erbjuder stöd, förmågor, verktyg, tekniska plattformar samt processer för samtliga utvecklingsteam inom Länsförsäkringar. Vi arbetar enligt SAFe, med en tydlig vision att skapa en hållbar och effektiv produktutveckling – där DevOps är en självklar grundförutsättning.
   

  

 Teamet består idag av Produkt Owners, DevOps Engineers, Scrum Masters och Process Owner som tillsammans ansvarar för våra förmågor och processer för IT-utveckling. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande laganda med högt i tak kultur och stora möjligheter till utveckling.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-23**

title: Tech lead/Architect Developer Experience (DevEx)
company_industry: Banking, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
If you're passionate about modern software delivery, thrive on optimizing the DevOps cycle, and want to shape the future of engineering at scale, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Drive Developer Experience for a community of 2500+ engineers, supporting thousands of builds daily—and scaling for more.
* Lead technical direction across multiple engineering teams focused on CI/CD orchestration, source control systems, and collaboration tools.
* Design and maintain scalable system architecture for source control platforms, ensuring performance, security, and compliance across the development lifecycle.
* Champion engineering excellence, embedding quality engineering principles, continuous improvement, and innovation into everything we build.
* Lead migration efforts from legacy systems to modern platforms, ensuring minimal disruption and data integrity.
* Mentor and guide teams in source control best practices, code quality, and platform usage—fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* A degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience—what matters most is your impact and expertise.
* 10+ years of software development experience and 3-5 years of experience as a Tech Lead or Solution Architect, with a strong foundation in software engineering.
* A hands-on leader who experiments with emerging tools and frameworks, while also shaping long-term architectural vision.
* A growth mindset and strong leadership skills—able to mentor, inspire, and foster an inclusive, collaborative culture.
* Excellent communication skills, capable of translating complex technical ideas into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders.
* Technical expertise we value:
+ Programming languages: Java, JavaScript, Python
+ Cloud platforms: Azure, AWS
+ Containerization: Docker, Kubernetes (AKS, OpenShift)
+ CI/CD tooling: Jenkins, GitHub Actions
+ Secure SDLC: Integrating security and compliance into all phases of development
+ Developer portals: homegrown, Backstage.io
+ Modern engineering practices: Agile, DevOps, and platform engineering with a focus on improving developer experience


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 contribute to our
 **Tech for Engineering** 
 unit that empowers over 250 development teams to deliver business value faster and with confidence. We build the internal platforms, tools, and services that streamline the software delivery lifecycle—from commit to production. At the heart of our mission is automation, quality engineering, and an exceptional developer experience.
   

  

 As your future manager, I bring clarity, energy, and a deep belief in people. I foster a collaborative, inclusive culture where structure supports—not stifles—innovation. I value practical solutions, open dialogue, and a shared commitment to continuous improvement. If you're driven by impact, enjoy smart teamwork, and want to grow in a supportive, high-performing environment, we’ll get along great."
 **Lorenz Versloot,** 
**your future manager**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 28.08.2025.
   

  

**Location: Sundbyberg**
**Recruiting manager: Lorenz Versloot**
 We want to inform you that the selection process may begin after the summer holidays.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Data DevOps Engineer
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day. We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





**About the Role** 




  





 As we continue to evolve and scale our platform, we're seeking a motivated DevOps Engineer with a passion for Data Technologies to support our Data Teams. The ideal candidate brings deep, hands-on expertise in managing, optimizing, and automating cloud infrastructure on AWS, with a focus on ensuring scalability, reliability, and high performance across our entire product ecosystem. This role requires initiative, resourcefulness, and autonomy. The DevOps Engineer should be able to design and deliver end-to-end solutions, diagnose and resolve issues efficiently, and drive a culture of continuous improvement. Additionally, strong communication skills are essential to collaborate with interdisciplinary stakeholders effectively. Success in this role also requires proactiveness, adaptability, and the ability to learn quickly when working with complex component integrations. The ideal candidate should be comfortable managing competing priorities, thinking critically, and applying creative problem-solving skills. A solid understanding of data science concepts, processes, tools, and infrastructure is essential, along with hands-on experience in AWS.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Ownership of the CI/CD pipeline ensuring a stable and performant platform/process.
* Effective communication with Operation's and Development teams.
* Continuously improve processes and documentation.
* Effective resolution of assigned tickets and tasks.
* Documentation and Knowledge sharing.
* Provide end to end solutions including its execution.
* Provide user support to engineering teams.
* Set up tools and required infrastructure.
* Encourage and build automated processes wherever possible.
* Incident management and root cause analysis.
* Follow the company processes, procedures, and methodologies.
* Collaborate to achieve common goals.
* Support and act in line with the company values.
* Keep up to date with compliance training offered by the company.



  





**Qualifications** 




  





 A solid understanding of data science concepts, processes, tools, and infrastructure is essential, along with hands-on experience in AWS.
 



  





**Required Skills** 




  




* Extensive experience working with AWS: EKS, EC2, S3, RDS, Redshift, DynamoDB, Lambda, EMR, Karpenter, Route53, IAM, etc.
* Strong experience designing CI/CD (Jenkins and ArgoCD) pipelines tailored to developer needs.
* Proficient in scripting and automation using Ansible, Python, and Bash.
* Hands-on experience containerizing applications using Docker and orchestrating them with Kubernetes or Docker Swarm.
* Familiarity with tools like Vault, Artifactory for secure secrets management and artifact delivery.
* Proficient in Git and Bitbucket for source control management.
* Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools, especially Terraform.
* Exposure to monitoring and observability tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and Kibana.
* Familiar with a range of infrastructure technologies: Couchbase, Elasticsearch, Oracle, MSSQL, PostgreSQL, and Kafka.



  





**Preferred Skills** 




  




* Data environments experience (Airflow, EMR, SageMaker, Ray, Tensorflow, MLflow, Kubeflow, Dask, Flink, Flask, Kserver).
* Exposure working with data lakes, data warehouse solutions (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).
* Exposure to PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, Kafka, Kafka Streams and Kafka Connect.
* Experience with Openstack, Azure/GCP and AWS (S3, Lambda, SageMaker, ECS, EKS, EC2, Step functions).
* Ability to write code to automate repeatable processes (Ansible, Python, Bash).
* Experience in using containers and orchestration to dockerize existing applications.
* Experience with docker clustering frameworks like Kubernetes, Docker Swarm.
* Experience in building and maintaining existing pipelines and its components, including, but not limited to, Jenkins, Gitlab, Argocd, SonarQube, Artifactory, Vault.
* Maintain configurations and deployments of software that operates within a highly scalable distributed multi-tenanted environment.
* Understanding of Source Control Management systems like GIT.
* Experience with provisioning tools to treat infrastructure as code, like Terraform.
* Experience with monitoring and APM tools like Prometheus, Kibana, Grafana, Cloudwatch, Loki, OpenTelemetry, Splunk, Elastic.



  





**Working conditions** 




  




* Occasional out of hour's conferencing with overseas colleagues.
* Occasional out of hours or weekend work.
* Learning & Development to assist you to achieve your career goals.
* Fast-paced agile environment, with leading-edge technology and innovation.
* Work in a collaborative environment with highly talented and motivated colleagues that are passionate about knowledge sharing.



  





**Functional Skills** 




  




* Ability to cope up with competing demands and remain focused on competing priorities.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with impact.

title: Senior Cloud Data Engineer - Clickstream
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





**About the Role** 




  





 At FDJ United, data and analytics are crucial to our growth and innovation as we expand into new markets. We are seeking a Senior Cloud Data Engineer with extensive experience in clickstream data to join our Analytics Tech team. In this role, you will manage our clickstream data architecture on AWS, ensuring the generation of high-quality datasets that accurately reflect customer behaviour across various digital platforms.
 



  





 You will work with cutting-edge technologies, including Snowplow for event tracking, Amazon Redshift for data warehousing, dbt cloud for data transformations, and Open Metadata for data governance. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you'll help define and implement next-generation data architectures that drive actionable insights and enhance operational efficiency. If you're passionate about leveraging data to understand customer behaviour, we invite you to take the next step in your career with us at FDJ United.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Equip analysts and other teams with efficient models for decision making, marketing, product reporting, analysis analysis.
* Drive automation initiatives by building schemas that facilitate automated data processing workflows, aligning with the long-term vision for Redshift.
* Drive the adoption of dbt as a service by providing training, support, and documentation, while ensuring data models are scalable and efficient.
* Develop and deploy a semantic layer to connect dbt models with natural language querying tools, enhancing data access and analysis for business users.
* Optimize time-to-insight through effective use of dbt and optimization of Redshift data structures.
* Share expertise in data collection and transformation practices to promote awareness of tracking and dbt across the organization.
* Support proof-of-concept generative AI initiatives to explore opportunities for operational efficiencies and business growth.
* Stay updated on advancements in data collection, transformation, cloud, and AI technologies, bringing innovative ideas to data engineering practices.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Strong understanding of clickstream data and data collection.
* Strong background in data modelling, particularly in clickstream data modelling.
* Extensive experience with data build tools such as dbt, and advanced data modelling skills.
* Understanding of AWS DevOps practices.
* Experience in implementing governance frameworks.
* Experience with data catalogues to document processes and data models for maintainability and knowledge transfer.
* Excellent proficiency in SQL, Python, or any other programming language (advantageous).
* Experience in introducing technical efficiencies as code optimisation and process improvements, such as ways of working.
* Ability to manage ambiguity, exhibiting a willingness to learn through iterative processes and demonstrating a proactive attitude.
* Excellent communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, translating business requirements into technical specifications for data models.
* Proven track record of taking ownership and successfully delivering large analytical projects while effectively managing stakeholders.



  





**Preferred Skills** 




  




* AWS certification.
* dbt certification.
* Experience as a digital analytics implementation developer.
* Knowledge of Python.



  





**Pay range and compensation package** 




  





 ⚡ A great team with passionate analysts and engineers
 



  





 🌍 Mix of 60+ nationalities and Swedish culture in an English-speaking environment
 



 🌆 Awesome offices with ergonomic desks, pool and table tennis tables, VR area, gym and yoga area, subsidised lunch, free breakfast, daily fresh fruits
 



 🛫 25 days paid vacation plus bank holidays
 



 🌳 3 days CSR leave
 



 🎯 Bonus plan
 



 📗 Training budget
 



 ⚕️ Private medical insurance and free eye test
 



 👶 Enhanced maternity, paternity, and shared parental leave
 



 🚲 £300 Wellbeing allowance
 



 💱 Up to 8% matched pension contributions
 



 🏡 Flexible working
 



 💼 Occasional travel to other FDJ United Group offices including Stockholm and Malta
 



 ☕ Meetups and calendar of social events in the office
 



  





**Equal Opportunity** 




  





 Statement At Kindred we see challenges as an opportunity to do something in a better way both personally and professionally. Our purpose is to transform gambling by being a trusted source of entertainment that contributes positively to society. Our ambition is to reach 0% revenue from harmful gambling by 2023. Our success is built on trust; we trust each other to deliver on our promises and believe giving ownership and responsibility at all levels is the way to make the right choices for Kindred and our
 
 customers.
 



  





**Our Way Of Working** 




  





 Our world is hybrid. A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
