 We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Process Owner
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Process Owner for Agile Production Teams at Scania Battery Production**
 Are you passionate about shaping the future of sustainable mobility? Do you thrive on leading agile teams and driving continuous improvements in high-tech manufacturing environments? At Scania Battery Production, we are looking for a
 **Process Owner** 
 to lead our new agile
 **Preparator Team** 
 —a critical function in delivering the battery solutions that will power tomorrow’s transportation. Our core value is the production process itself—everything that enables and facilitates it. Our mission is to ensure we have the right production processes and strategies for today’s and tomorrow’s products.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Process Owner** 
 for the preparators at the Battery Production Unit at Scania, you act as the team’s primary customer representative and link to the overall Production & Logistics strategy. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive continuous improvement initiatives and support the development of innovative battery technologies.
   

  

 As Process Owner, your primary mission is to maximise the value delivered by your team by guiding them in understanding and consistently delivering on customer needs. You’ll act as a strategic leader—defining, prioritising, and maintaining the process backlog to ensure alignment with evolving business goals. In this role, you will also develop and maintain a clear roadmap, outlining key milestones, timelines, and deliverables that support our business objectives. With a strong focus on end-to-end process oversight, you'll ensure that our production workflows are efficient and always aligned with customer expectations.
   

  

**The Team**
 The team consists of 10 people, of whom 6 are women. The roles included in the team are: Process Owner, Scrum Master, global preparators and local preparators. The primary responsibility of the preparators is to prepare all new articles and products, ensuring that each production line can operate smoothly. The system the preparators are working include ERP systems as MONA-assembly and SAP, as well as our MES system EBBA. In addition, we also work within the database called OAS.
   

  

**Experience And Qualifications**
* Education: Scania Technician, Bachelor or Master of Science degree.
* Experience: Minimum of 3 years in a manufacturing or production environment, preferably in the automotive or battery industry.
* Language skills: Professional level of spoken and written English is essential
* Technical Knowledge: You have at least 1 year of experience in preparation. In addition, knowledge of the production systems; OAS, SAP, EBBA and MONA is meriting.


**What We Offer**
 Be at the forefront of Scania’s sustainable future, working with cutting-edge battery technology and driving the shift toward electrification. Join us to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Apply via our internal career portal, Scania’s public careers page, or on LinkedIn by 2025-08-31. Your application should include a CV and relevant education certificates/transcripts. The selection for the position will take place continuously. A background check may be conducted as part of the recruitment process.
   

  

 For more details, please contact the hiring manager
 **Anmol Khawaja** 
 by anmol.khawaja@scania.com
   

  

**Apply today to bring your expertise and leadership to Scania Battery Production!**

title: Program Manager New Platform Development
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

**Lead the Future of Ventilation Technology**
 Getinge Critical Care in Solna is now strengthening our product development organization with a Program manager. At Critical Care we develop tomorrow’s intensive care products and equipment, and we are in an intensive period of change and expansion. In this role you will be a key player within our R&D organization and have the possibility to take an active part in how we run product development, and in our ongoing agile change journey.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 We are developing the most advanced ventilators in the world. To continue this vision, we need a Program Manager who can drive the new technology development from concept to launch.
   

  

 Why this role matters
   

  

* Deliver a future-proof, modular platform for new ventilation products.
* Build and guide a high-performing core team — aligning technical, operational, and business goals.
* Drive execution end-to-end — balancing innovation, regulatory demands, and speed-to-market.
* Make high-impact decisions daily — keeping priorities clear and momentum strong.
* Interface with senior leaders across R&D, Operations, Marketing, and QA/RA.


**Your Main Responsibilities And Tasks Will Be**
* Lead a groundbreaking development program through all phases: concept, architecture, design, verification, and launch.
* Secure scope, budget, timeline, and quality for the entire program portfolio.
* Coach and energize cross-functional teams (software, electronics, mechanics, clinical, regulatory, supply chain).
* Champion agile/lean practices, modern toolchains, and data-driven decision making.
* Manage internal and outsourced development partners, ensuring seamless collaboration.
* Report program status, risks, and mitigation plans to the Critical Care management team.


 The position is based at our site in Solna but offers the flexibility to work from home when suitable. The role requires occasional international travel. You will be reporting to the Head of New Platform Development in Critical Care.
   

  

**You will bring**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree within Engineering
* 10+ years’ experience leading complex product-development programs (med-tech, automotive, or high-tech preferred).
* Strong leadership that unites cross-functional teams behind a bold vision.
* Deep technical know-how in embedded systems, software, electronics, and mechanics.
* Proven success managing both internal and external development partners.
* Hands-on experience with agile methodologies and modern product-development processes.
* Fluent English; Swedish (or willingness to learn) is an advantage.
* Exposure to regulated environments (ISO 13485 / FDA 21 CFR 820) is highly meritorious.


 To succeed in this position, you need to be an entrepreneurial, decisive leader who thrives in fast-paced settings. You turn ambitious ideas into reality, inspire teams, and navigate obstacles to deliver cutting-edge products that save lives.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible, but no later than 2025-09-10. We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 For this position we will conduct a background check on the final candidate.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Johan Widman at johan.widman@getinge.com or Talent Acquisition Manager Emma Paulsson at emma.paulsson@getinge.com .
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.
   

  

 Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Senior IT-arkitekt till CGI
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du arbeta i teknikens framkant och bidra till en mer hållbar framtid? CGI söker nu en senior IT-arkitekt som vill vara med och leverera lösningar till några av Sveriges mest samhällskritiska aktörer inom energi- och försörjningssektorn.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i uppdrag hos våra kunder inom elnät, fjärrvärme, elhandel, vatten och avlopp där digitaliseringen är central för en säker och effektiv energiförsörjning.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du att verka som ledande IT-arkitekt i uppdrag och projekt hos CGI:s kunder inom energibranschen. Du blir en nyckelperson i att ta fram arkitekturlösningar som är hållbara, skalbara och anpassade efter kundens affärs- och verksamhetsmål. Du kommer att samarbeta med både kundens verksamhet och tekniska team i tätt samspel med CGI:s egna konsulter för att säkra en leverans i världsklass.
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig med erfarenhet som:
   

  

* Lösningsarkitekt
* Informationsarkitekt
* Infrastrukturarkitekt
* Integrationsarkitekt


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Minst 7 års erfarenhet som IT-arkitekt inom något av ovan nämnda områden
* Tidigare erfarenhet från den svenska energibranschen
* Förmåga att driva tekniska vägval och omvandla affärsbehov till lösningar
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga och trivs i konsultrollen
* Flytande svenska och mycket god engelska i tal och skrift


 Meriterande är:
   

  

* Certifieringar inom TOGAF, ArchiMate, Azure, AWS eller liknande
* Förståelse för branschspecifika regelverk (t.ex. EI, GDPR, NIS2)
* Tidigare erfarenhet av leverans i konsultroll eller större transformationsprogram


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 På CGI blir du delägare i företaget genom vårt aktieprogram, vilket speglar vår kultur av långsiktighet och engagemang. Du blir del av ett erfaret arkitektnätverk där du har möjlighet att utvecklas, utmanas och bidra till arkitekturens riktning både inom CGI och hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Du får:
   

  

* Leverera lösningar i teknikens framkant till ledande energibolag
* Vara del av ett av Sveriges mest erfarna IT-arkitektteam
* Flexibilitet i var och hur du arbetar
* Möjlighet till personlig utveckling och certifieringar


 Plats: Stockholm - hybridarbete möjligt i viss omfattning
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan i dag! Om du har frågor om rollen, hör gärna av dig till rekryterande ledare Jakob Elkert, Director Consulting Services/ Konsultchef, på jakob.elkert@cgi.com
   

  

 Välkommen till CGI där du får vara med och bygga framtidens hållbara samhälle!
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: VP Sales Nordics
description:
*At Benifex, we’re on a mission to revolutionize employee benefits and engagement. Born from the merger of Benify and Benefex, we’ve combined forces to build remarkable experiences that employees love. With 1,200+ Benifexers across 14 global offices, we partner with 3,000 customers in 120+ countries, supporting 5 million users worldwide* 
*🌍* 
*Ready to be part of an exciting journey ahead? Welcome to Benifex!*
 Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment where collaboration, drive, and ambition are key to success? We’re looking for a VP Sales, Nordics to lead our sales professionals across the region and take our growth to the next level. You will report to the CEO, Nordics, and be part of the Nordic leadership team, helping shape the strategic direction of the business.
   

  

 We are looking for someone with extensive hands-on experience in sales leadership, with a deep understanding of what drives success in individual performance and organizational strategy. This role is essential for driving the regional sales strategy to meet and exceed revenue targets. The VP Sales will be responsible for developing and delivering accurate forecasts, standardizing and optimizing sales methodologies, and working closely with the broader organization to align efforts and achieve company-wide goals.
   

  

**As VP Sales Nordics, You Will**
* Lead, coach, and inspire a growing team of over 10+ sales professionals across our Nordic offices.
* Own and execute the regional sales strategy across both private and public sectors to meet and exceed revenue targets.
* Support your team with strategic pipeline reviews, opportunity planning, and performance development.
* Build forecasting models and deliver accurate, data-driven revenue forecasts to executive leadership.
* Optimize sales processes, methodologies, and ways of working to drive efficiency and consistency.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Customer Success, Product, and other teams to ensure alignment and shared success.
* Lead recruitment, onboarding, and training of team members to ensure a strong and scalable sales force.
* You’ll collaborate closely with leaders in other departments and act as a strategic voice in internal discussions to ensure that sales insights, needs, and opportunities are consistently integrated into the broader company strategy.
* Continuously challenge the status quo to evolve our sales approach and drive transformation.


 You will play a pivotal role in redefining and rebuilding our sales strategy – and be a driving force in shaping a team culture built on psychological safety, ownership, and a high-performance, hunter mindset.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Several years of experience in B2B sales, specifically within SaaS or IT software solutions.
* Proven success in scaling sales organizations, managing complex sales cycles, and consistently exceeding revenue targets.
* Strong leadership skills with a track record of coaching and developing high-performing sales teams.
* Demonstrated ability to build and execute go-to-market strategies across the Nordic region.
* Experience driving transformation and delivering results in fast-paced, dynamic environments.
* Solid understanding of both mid-market (SME) and enterprise sales.
* Proficient in using tools like Salesforce or HubSpot to support performance management and data-driven decision-making.
* Fluency in Swedish, as the role requires close collaboration and communication with customers in Sweden.
* Willingness to travel occasionally across the Nordics.


**Desired Qualifications**
* Experience working in the HR space or with HR tech products, with an understanding of the ecosystem and stakeholder landscape.


**Your Mindset And Approach**
* You are passionate about sales and business growth.
* You’re a motivational leader with a proven ability to develop talent and build high-performing teams where members feel empowered, engaged, and set up for success.
* You challenge conventional thinking and are constantly looking for smarter ways to work.
* You thrive in a data-driven culture and use data-driven insights to make strategic decisions.
* You enjoy being hands-on, adding value to customer interactions, and leading by example.


**Perks** 
**⭐**
* 30 days’ vacation
* Generous wellness allowance
* ITP1 Pension and Lifeplan - a tool that provides you with personalized advice to optimize your pension savings
* Workation - possibility to work abroad within EU
* Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid working model
* A variety of social events and activities in the offices
* You're responsible for your own development and we offer internal career opportunities.


**Are you ready to take on a key leadership role in a dynamic SaaS environment? Apply now and join us on our journey to success!**
**Practical information
   

  

 Extent:** 
 Full-time, 100%
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm (the team is located both in Stockholm and Copenhagen).
   

  

**Start date:** 
 As soon as we find the right match.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 We will be pausing our recruitment process during the end of June, throughout July, and into mid/late August due to the summer holiday period. We will resume reviewing applications and get back to candidates after this break. Thank you for your patience and understanding!
   

  

*Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile using the application form below. We screen applications continuously and may hire someone before the last application date.*
*Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply.*

title: Data Management Specialist at Scania
job_function: Engineering, Information Technology, and Project Management
description:
**Do you want to shape the future of data management? Join Scania as a Data Management Specialist to drive Master Data and Quality**
 Scania is on an exciting transformation journey where Data Management plays a crucial role in the future of the business. As a Data Management Specialist, you will play a key role in developing and implementing strategies for Master Data, Data Quality and Data Governance. You will be part of a dynamic Information Management team where you will work with the business and IT to create effective processes and ensure that data is used appropriately to drive innovation and improvement.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 This is a new role within Production and Logistics and we offer you a broad, challenging and fulfilling position in an exciting time of change. As part of Scania´s Information Management team, you will play a key role in establishing and driving effective data governance processes, ensuring data quality and developing master data management.
   

  

**Here You Are Offered**
* A dynamic work environment with exciting challenges.
* Opportunity to influence and drive developments in Data Management.
* A culture of innovation, sustainability and continuous improvement
* Competitive benefits and opportunities for professional development.


**Your Challenge**
**Responsibilities**
 As a Data Management Specialist, you will be responsible for driving and developing areas such as Data Governance, Master Data Management and Data Quality Management by developing Data Management structures and processes. This means that you will:
   

  

* Set strategies and processes for data creation, maintenance and utilisation in line with core standards and services.
* Lead master data initiatives and ensure that the information- and data architecture supports business needs.
* Develop and implement data standards and ensure compliance with guidelines.
* Identify and address data quality issues and drive improvement projects.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with the business, IT and external partners to optimise data management.


**The Team and Workplace**
 You will be part of the Scania Information Management team within Global Industrial Development. The team consists of dedicated specialists who drive the development of data management in production and logistics. Here you will have the opportunity to work in an innovative and collaborative environment where you can both contribute your expertise and develop in line with Scania´s transformation.
   

  

 We offer a modern working environment and flexible working conditions and you will be based at the Södertälje site.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for you who have a strong understanding of Data Management and its strategic importance in a large organisation. You have experience working with Data Management in complex environments and are used to leading initiatives in Data Governance and Master Data Management. An understanding of how data and information is used in Production and Logistics flows is a plus.
   

  

 As a person you are analytical, structured and proactive. You thrive in a role where you get to drive change and collaborate with both technical and business stakeholders. You have good communication skills and can communicate the importance of good data management to different parts of the organisation in an educational way. You are comfortable with both Swedish and English as working languages.
   

  

**Let´s Connect!**
 We have chosen to work with Ada Digital in this recruitment. Their recruitment process focuses on transparency, inclusion and a fast moving candidate experience. And now we want to know more about you – on your own terms! To apply, please fill out the short form, briefly motivate why you are interested in the position, and attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile. No additional documentation is needed. You can then, in real-time, follow your application online as our recruiters are working with it. We work with a continues selection process which means we might hire a candidate before the final apply date, so apply already today! Interested and want to know more? Please contact our recruiter today. We are looking forward to connecting soon!

title: Area Controller – Area 5 - Mälardalen
description:
**Company Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 We are now looking for an Area Business Controller to Area 5 Mälardalen!
   

  

 As a Area Controller at H&M, you will be responsible for the Store P&L and for driving forward key KPIs. You will lead operational controlling strategies through strong cooperation with your Area Team and stores. Together with the Area Team you are responsible for reaching the Sales & Profit goals by securing that the stores deliver a great customer service. Acting as a leader with a strong analytical focus and knowledge-based approach, you train and coach stores and your Area Team on controlling topics, to enable our people and our business to grow. You work in accordance with legal requirements and H&M standards, policies and procedures to meet the expectations of our customers and colleagues.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Increase selling and profitability
   

  

* Be an ambassador for a profitability mindset
* Ensuring profitable growth on all P&L lines related to store
* Set commercial action plans in line with country goals on a daily, weekly, monthly basis
* Perform monthly Profit & Loss analysis.


 Secure correct scheduling
   

  

* Regularly follow up on sales and hours planning
* Set hourly function plans with store management to enable strong store operations
* Set the desired contract structure for every store, in line with the country goals


 Secure best practice garment availability
   

  

* Drive commerciality and selling
* Together with merchandising and stores, follow up on/ensure the right stock levels


 People and Teams
   

  

 Acting as a leader with a strong analytical focus and knowledge-based approach; you support stores and the area team to enable great teams from a controlling perspective
 *.*
* Collaborate regularly with functions across the Country support office
* Educate store management and area team members on all controlling aspects
* Support your area team members with clear analysis to support their development and actions


**Who You’ll Work With**
 In this role, you will collaborate with multiple teams to ensure the successful expansion of the business. You will work closely with the Area, Controlling, and Store teams, providing key insights and recommendations.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
 Being part of our omni journey means there is not one clear path. We ask you to be open to change and take part in creating an organization for the future. This is an opportunity for open-minded team players that by being curious, innovative, and forward-thinking want to change our business and the whole industry.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Has minimum 2 years experience from similar position
* Has leadership ability and a strategic mindset
* Has strong analytical skills with proven ability to drive goals forward.
* Achieve results beyond expectations in your current position.
* Is a true role model with strong leadership skills who demonstrates our values


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, apply by sending your application in English through the career site as soon as possible but
 **no later than 24th August, 2025. We are conducting interviews throughout the application process.**
**This is a permanent position starting as soon as possible. The position is based in our Area 5 Office in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Senior Nätverkskonsult
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Har du erfarenhet av nätverkslösningar och vill jobba nära kund? Motiveras du av att få jobba med stora och spännande nätverk där ditt jobb gör skillnad? Då vill jag lära känna dig!
 



  





 Jag heter Solveig Jagelid och jag ansvarar för vårt fantastiska konsulteam Hybrid IT & Networking i region Öst. Jag söker dig som vill arbeta i rollen som
 **Senior Nätverkskonsult** 
 och vara med på en spännande IT-resa tillsammans med våra kunder. Har du några års erfarenhet av nätverkslösningar och vill jobba nära kund? Då tror jag att du kommer att trivas och utvecklas hos oss på Telia Cygate.
 



  





**Är det här din nästa möjlighet?** 




 Som Senior Nätverkskonsult får du arbeta högt som lågt med planering och design av olika nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar till installation, konfiguration och felsökning i våra riktigt stora kunders IT-miljöer. Våra kund- och leveransprojekt spänner ofta över flera tjänsteområden. Det innebär att du kommer få arbeta nära andra specialister inom våra tre fokusområden, nätverk, säkerhet och hybrid IT. Här kan du få djupare insikt och ny inspiration i allt från Cloud, Security, Automation och on-prem, och de senaste kombinationerna där emellan. Vi se gärna att du kontinuerligt certifierar dig och vill att du ska utvecklas.
 



  





 Rollen inkluderar, men är inte begränsad till:
 


* Planering och design av nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar hos kund på olika nivåer
* Installation, konfiguration och felsökning i komplexa IT-miljöer hos stora kunder
* Självständigt arbete, med mycket kundkontakt



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Som person motiveras du av att skapa förändring och har en förmåga att engagera kunder såväl som dina kollegor. Du kommer särskilt till din rätt när du får ge utlopp för tankar och idéer där du använder din verksamhetsförståelse för att omsätta krav till genomförbara lösningar. Förutom det får du tillhöra en växande organisation som uppmuntrar dig på din egen utvecklingsresa; varför inte certifiera dig med oss och utforska det senaste som ex. Aruba, Fortinet och Cisco.
 



  





 Dina erfarenheter:
 


* Flera års relevant erfarenhet inom Nätverksteknik alt. liknande
* Certifiering inom Aruba, Cisco och/eller Fortinet ses som starkt meriterande
* Goda kunskaper inom Routing och Switching
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift. Svensk medborgare.



  





**Varför Telia Cygate?** 




 På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.
 



  





 Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.
 



  





 Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan!
 



  





**Intresserad?** 




 Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team! Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig.
 



  





 Placeringsort: Stockholm
 



  





 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta mig gärna, Solveig Jagelid på solveig.jagelid@cygate.se eller via LinkedIn. Sista ansökningsdag är
 **2025-08-17** 




  





 Bakgrundskontroll är en del i våra rekryteringsprocesser.
 



  





**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Senior Cyber Security Specialist
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

 Inom AFRY Cyber Security & Resilience söker vi en erfaren och engagerad cybersäkerhetsspecialist som vill vara med och skydda samhällsviktig infrastruktur. Hos oss får du arbeta i ett nationellt team med hög kompetens, där vi tillsammans utvecklar hållbara säkerhetslösningar för framtiden.
   

  

 Vi är en ledande aktör inom cybersäkerhet, särskilt inom försvarssektorn och samhällskritiska verksamheter. Våra uppdrag är långsiktiga och vi arbetar i konsultteam där kunskapsdelning och utveckling står i fokus.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Som Senior Cyber Security Specialist kommer du att arbeta med varierande och meningsfulla uppdrag inom både offentlig och privat sektor. Du får möjlighet att bidra till säkerheten i samhällskritiska verksamheter och samtidigt utveckla din specialistkompetens.
   

  

 Möjliga arbetsområden:
   

  

* Stötta kunder inom försvarsindustrin och andra samhällsviktiga områden
* Utföra hot-, risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser, teknisk planering och säkerhetsbedömningar
* Implementera standarder som ISO 27001, R-155/156, ISO 21434, Maskindirektivet och NIS2
* Leverera tekniska rapporter
* Fungera som rådgivare kring ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet
* Automatisera och optimera processer med verktyg som Ansible och Python
* Övervaka och förbättra molnbaserade infrastrukturer för hög tillgänglighet och prestanda
* Ansvara för CI/CD-processer och samarbete med kundens utvecklings- och driftsteam


 Vi söker nu medarbetare till Stockholm/Solna, Göteborg och Trollhättan.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Du har en akademisk examen inom säkerhet, cyber, IT, systemutveckling, IT Drift eller ett närliggande tekniskt område, alternativt tillskansat dig kunskaper i dessa områden via yrkeslivet.
   

  

 Du har arbetat minst tre år inom IT- eller cybersäkerhetsområdet och har erfarenhet av att utveckla system, driftlösningar eller arbeta enligt DevSecOps-principer. Du är van vid teknisk riskhantering och planering, och har god förståelse för cybersäkerhetsstandarder som ISO 27001, R-155/156, ISO 21434, Maskindirektivet och NIS2. Du är trygg i rollen som sakkunnig i rådgivning som rör ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet. Då vi jobbar mot olika svenska myndigheter och organisationer så är goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift ett krav.
   

  

 Meriterande om du har något av följande:
   

  

* Arbetat med regelverk som Cybersecurity Act, Cyber Resilience Act, NIS2-direktivet eller DORA
* Erfarenhet av OWASP/ MITRE ATT@CK, D3FEND, EMB3D och NIST 800 series
* Bakgrund inom försvar eller annan samhällsviktig verksamhet
* Erfarenhet från flera olika branscher – det är en tillgång i konsultrollen
* Erfarenhet av att jobbat med ledningsgrupper gärna som managementkonsult
* ITIL certifierad


 Vem är du?
   

  

 En självgående person som är trygg i att fatta beslut och ta ansvar, samtidigt som du har lätt för att anpassa dig till olika kunders behov. Du trivs i samarbete med andra och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till kollegor. Med din professionella och lyhörda inställning skapar du mervärde både för teamet och för våra kunder. Du är också en person som bygger relationer naturligt, är nyfiken på nya perspektiv och ser möjligheter där andra ser hinder.
   

  

 Du är en Brave, Devoted Teamplayer - och lever efter AFRYs ledord och vågar ta modiga beslut och leverera högklassiga resultat!
   

  

**Då vi ofta jobbar inom säkerhetsklassade uppdrag kan denna tjänst komma att kräva säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll innan en anställning.** 
**Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav.**
**Tjänsteresor förekommer i rollen.**
**Ytterligare information**
**VI ERBJUDER**
 På AFRY erbjuder vi en modern arbetsplats med globalt perspektiv, kollektivavtal och en rad personalförmåner. Vår personalklubb Club AFRY organiserar sociala aktiviteter för att stärka gemenskapen.
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att mångfald stärker oss och strävar efter att skapa en kreativ och framgångsrik arbetsplats. Vi satsar på våra medarbetares utveckling med individuella utvecklingsplaner och möjlighet att ta kurser och certifieringar.
   

  

 Vi tror på balans mellan arbets- och privatliv och strävar efter att skapa en hälsosam arbetsmiljö. Det är kanske därför vi rankas som en av Sveriges mest populära arbetsgivare.
   

  

 En inspirerande arbetsmiljö där vi arbetar i framkant inom Cybersäkerhet och deltar i diverse utvecklingsprojekt med främsta branschaktörerna och medverkar på mässor.
   

  

**KONTAKTPERSONER**
 Nicklas Täck, Sektionschef Product & Info Security, Trollhättan/Göteborg
   

  

 nicklas.tack@afry.com
   

  

 Denim Nygren, Sektionschef Civil Security & Defence, Stockholm
   

  

 denim.nygren@afry.com
   

  

 Ellinor Danielsson, Talent Aquisition Partner
   

  

 ellinor.danielsson@afry.com
   

  

***Sista ansökningsdag är 20 augusti. Urval och intervjuer kommer påbörjas under senare delen av augusti/början av september.***
*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Senior Sales Specialist
company_industry: Computer Hardware Manufacturing, Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Vill du skapa skräddarsydda lösningar för våra kunder och bli en del av ett riktigt härligt team? Vi söker en erfaren säljare inom IT som vill ta nästa steg i sin karriär och göra skillnad för våra kunder på Sveriges västkust.
   

  

 Vi söker en säljare som bor och kan verka på västkusten med närhet till alla de kunder rollen kommer ha som ansvarsområde.
   

  

 Om HP Inc. och vårt team HP Inc. är ett globalt teknikföretag som ständigt strävar efter att skapa innovativa lösningar inom IT, print och digitala tjänster. Vi har en stark närvaro i Sverige och arbetar aktivt med både privata och offentliga aktörer för att erbjuda hållbara och smarta lösningar.
   

  

 Det här specifika teamet fokuserar på att skapa värde för den offentliga sektorn med hjälp av vårt stora utbud av produkter och lösningar. Att skapa goda relationer som genomsyras av förtroende, hjälpsamhet och förståelse för behov är bland det viktigaste i rollen. Vi brinner för att skapa långsiktiga relationer och lösningar som gör skillnad på riktigt.
   

  

 Ledare för teamet är Magnus Janson och han har varit en del av HP i 26 år vilket är ett resultat av den fina kultur vi har! HP är ett Företag man trivs på och växer med. Magnus är en erfaren och kunnig ledare med en stark strategisk vision och ett stort engagemang för både affärer och människor. Med en coachande ledarstil uppmuntrar han innovation, samarbete och personlig utveckling – och ser till att teamet har rätt förutsättningar för att lyckas.
   

  

 Vad får du ut av den här rollen?
   

  

* En nyckelroll i ett innovativt företag där dina idéer och lösningar gör skillnad.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande kunder och komplexa affärsutmaningar.
* En arbetsplats där balans mellan arbete och fritid är en självklarhet.
* En härlig teamkultur med högt i tak och mycket skratt.


**Vad Vi Vill Att Du Bidrar Med**
* Din expertis inom lösningsarkitektur och affärsutveckling.
* En strategisk och kundfokuserad inställning.
* Förmåga att identifiera och utveckla affärsmöjligheter.
* Ett starkt driv för att skapa värde för både kunder och företaget.
* En vilja att dela med dig av din kunskap och stötta dina kollegor.


**Vad Du Kommer Att Göra**
* Förstå och analysera våra produkter och branschen för att positionera dem på bästa sätt.
* Bygga och stärka relationer med nyckelkunder, inklusive beslutsfattare på hög nivå.
* Skapa skräddarsydda lösningar i samarbete med våra produkt- och teknikspecialister.
* Identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter och maximera potentialen i befintliga kunder.
* Genomföra marknadsanalyser och bidra till utvecklingen av våra försäljningsstrategier.
* Fokusera på att förlänga och utveckla kontrakt med större kunder.
* Samla in kundfeedback för att påverka framtida produktutveckling.
* Säkerställa att vi följer alla relevanta regler och föreskrifter.
* Fungera som kundens röst och lösa eventuella problem snabbt och smidigt.


 Vem är du?
   

  

* Du har en relevant utbildning inom försäljning, marknadsföring eller affärsutveckling, eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Du har 7-10 års erfarenhet inom teknisk försäljning, lösningsförsäljning eller kontohantering.
* Du är en mästare på kundrelationer och att skapa värde för både kund och företag.
* Du är en strategisk tänkare med öga för affärsutveckling och lösningsorienterad försäljning.
* Du har en naturlig förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta över olika avdelningar.
* Du är driven och självmotiverad vilket innebär att du förstår vad som krävs i olika situationer och agerar därefter
* Eftersom vi är ett Globalt Företag, kräver rollen att du har goda kunskaper i Engelska, bade i tal och skrift. Vi ser därför helst att ditt CV är på Engelska.


 Varför ska du välja oss? Förutom att få jobba i en spännande roll med stort ansvar, får du också njuta av västkustens fördelar där du utgår från ditt eget hem i vår förmånsbil i jakt på nya affärer och kundrelationer!
   

  

 Låter det som något för dig? Skicka in ditt CV och låt oss prata vidare!

title: Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft
description:
Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Microsoft Cloud services, where you'll design, implement, and manage cutting-edge Azure solutions, collaborate with talented professionals, and grow your career with personalized development plans and access to top-tier certifications.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft unique**
* Take ownership as a technical Lead in a specialized service area, shaping strategic solutions and driving innovation
* Cutting-Edge Technology Exposure: Work hands-on with Microsoft Cloud technologies like Azure, Power Platform, and DevOps, keeping you at the forefront of industry advancements
* Access personalized career development, Microsoft certifications, and holistic well-being support, ensuring both professional and personal success


 As a Senior Azure Engineer, you will work with delivery projects, maintenance, development, and life cycle management of our Managed Services platforms. The position also includes 3rd line level support, incident handling, change and problem management related to our European Portfolio under Cloud Services e.g. Azure Operate, Azure Migrate, Landing Zone and Azure Ready Assessment.
   

  

 My name is Heidi Storm, Head of Microsoft Cloud Services. As a leader, I am dedicated and transparent, always championing a "Win as a Team" mentality. I believe in fostering a welcoming, supportive, and solution-oriented environment where everyone can grow, collaborate, and make a real impact.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Public Cloud Consultant** 
**Microsoft**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for designing, implementing, and managing scalable cloud architectures using Microsoft Azure, while collaborating with development teams to enhance cloud-based services, automate operations, and ensure optimal performance and reliability.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of delivering our Standardized Services efficiently and effectively. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with the Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams to ensure seamless implementation and customer success.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams, to develop, maintain, and successfully deliver customer projects
* Providing 3rd line support by handling incidents, managing changes, and solving complex problems within the European Portfolio to ensure seamless service delivery
* Developing and maintaining internal support tools to optimize workflows, streamline project deployments, and assist consultants in delivering high-quality solutions


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who is passionate about Microsoft cloud technologies, thrives in a collaborative environment, and enjoys solving complex technical challenges to deliver high-quality solutions.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Have**
* A bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* 5+ years of experience in Microsoft cloud solutions, with a focus on Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and Microsoft server infrastructure
* A strong understanding of Azure services, including Virtual Machines, Azure DevOps, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure networking, Azure Backup, and Azure Firewall
* Experience with infrastructure as code utilizing ARM templates/JSON
* Knowledge of identity services like Windows Active Directory, Entra ID, and Entra ID domain services
* Proficient in English, as it is the main language used for all internal and external communications. Additionally, proficiency in one of the local languages spoken in Dustin’s operating countries (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish, Dutch, Finnish, or French) is a plus


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with the recruiter Elza van Grootel- Coenraats
* 1st interview with Heidi Storm
* 2nd interview with Technical Lead from the team & Heidi Storm
* 3rd interview with Jonas Sjöberg (Director for Managed Services)


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Elza van Grootel- Coenraats via e-mail

title: Teknisk SAP-Konsult
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, IT System Custom Software Development, and Software Development
description:
*Brinner du för SAP-teknik och har förmågan att kombinera teknisk expertis med funktionell insikt? Vi söker dig som vill skapa förståelse för våra kunders affärsprocesser och inspirera dem att utveckla innovativa tekniska lösningar.* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som teknisk SAP-konsult hos Zington blir du en nyckelspelare i att hjälpa våra kunder att realisera sina digitala ambitioner. Ditt uppdrag är att omsätta affärsbehov till praktiska och innovativa SAP-lösningar. Med en djup förståelse för verktygets mångsidighet hjälper du kunder att agera på deras kunddata, vilket optimerar deras affärsprocesser. Oavsett om det gäller automatisering, rapportering eller integration med andra system, blir du den expert som vägleder och formar den tekniska lösningen i samarbete med kund och team. I denna roll kombineras teknisk skicklighet med strategisk insikt, arbetandes sida vid sida med Zingtons expertteam. Vill du ta din karriär till nästa nivå och utveckla framtidens kundupplevelser? Välkommen att ansöka!
 



  





**Dina kompetenser och egenskaper** 



* Utbildning som ingenjör, ekonom eller arbetslivserfarenheter som demonstrerar en stark förmåga att sätta sig in och lösa problem.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av SAP, gärna i rollen som konsult.
* Förstår vikten av göra det lilla extra när det behövs men kan samtidigt ge sig själv (och andra) en paus när det behövs.
* Trivs i att verka i en föränderlig miljö och inser att flexibilitet är en superkraft.
* Vågar ta hjälp och även hjälpa andra.
* Nyfiken.



  





**Mer om rollen** 




 Vi rekryterar löpande och ser gärna att du kan börja så snart som möjligt men månar om att hitta rätt person. Därför värderar vi dina personliga egenskaper och att vi trivs ihop högt.
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta rekryterande chef Andreas Åkerblad på andreas.akerblad@zingtongroup.com
 



  





**Om Zington** 




 Zington är ett konsultföretag med expertis inom Management, IT och Design. Vår resa började redan 2008 men idag är vi 250 medarbetare i Stockholm och fler än 4000 kollegor globalt inom VASS koncernen. Vi stöttar kunder som ex. Atrium Ljungberg, Axfood, Apollo och Fora i digital transformation genom att skapa tjänster, bygga lösningar och utforma strategier som driver affären framåt. På Zington ligger vår styrka i våra medarbetare. Oavsett om du är en specialist eller generalist kan vi som konsultföretag erbjuda dig en plats att växa och trivas på. Vi strävar efter att vara en plats där vi stöttar varandra, delar med oss av vår kunskap och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår framgång bygger på engagerade människor – när du växer, växer företag.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? Are you a seasoned Senior Accountant looking to take your career to the next level? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your expertise can make a real impact? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!
   

  

**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 300 employees across several entities such as Sweden, Germany, Denmark, Finland & the US, and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Senior Accountant who wants to make a difference in our finance team.
   

  

**Group Functions**
 Truesec consists of several domains who act as partners towards our customers within various different areas of cyber security. The group function supports with e.g. Marketing, People & Culture, Internal IT and Finance and do so both locally and globally. All functions act and collaborate with the organization with a business objective in mind as the tasks are crucial for Truesec to continue to prevent cyber breach and minimize impact.
   

  

**A key role for a successful Finance Team**
 We are looking for an enthusiastic, proactive and competent senior accountant to our finance team. Truesec is a fast-growing company with international ambitions so the role has plenty of opportunities for growth. You will assist with the development of our systems and processes, be a key player in the monthly financial close and reporting to ensure operational success.
   

  

 You will gain increasing experience as the company grows utilizing technology to develop processes for a lean mean finance function. You will be responsible for ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting, maintaining compliance with regulations and providing strategic financial guidance to senior management.
   

  

 If you have an accounting background, love a challenges and want to be part of a fast-growing business and amazing team, we’d like to meet you.
   

  

 In this position you report directly to Finance Manager and the role is based at the Office in central Stockholm.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Prepare and analyze financial statements (K3) including group consolidation and cash flow statements.
* Prepare monthly, quarterly, and year-end closing processes, ensuring accuracy and completeness of financial data
* Perform full balance sheet reconciliations and Inter-company re-invoicing and reconciliations between entities
* Ensure accurate Tax and VAT reporting
* Manage and drive compliance and statutory reporting and the external audit process
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and accounting firms across our entities (Finland, Denmark, Germany, USA)
* Leading initiatives to ensure process improvement, system development and always strive to improve
* Any other ad hoc tasks as and when required


**Your Potential Background**
 You have a strong foundation in finance, with experience in monthly closing and tax. You’re detail-oriented, organized and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously. Your proactive approach allows you to identify areas for improvement while maintaining compliance with financial standards. You are a team player and have a service-minded attitude which makes you a natural collaborator who thrives in a team-oriented environment.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (CPA or CMA preferred)
* 5+ years of experience in accounting and ownership of month-end closing.
* Strong knowledge of local GAAP and financial reporting standards
* Experience with ERP systems (e.g., Visma Net, Severa) and Excel proficiency
* Strong analytical, organizational and communication skills


**Other Requirements:**
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken
* Willingness to travel occasionally, as required


***Due to the sensitivity of our work, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.***
 Why Join Us? As a Senior Accountant you will play a pivotal role in driving financial excellence and ensuring regulatory compliance in one of our key markets. You’ll have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment, contribute to strategic initiatives, and be part of a global team dedicated to achieving organizational success.
   

  

 Apply now to become a cornerstone of our financial operations and help shape the future of our organization!

title: Lösningsarkitekt inom Business intelligence till Knowit i Stockholm
description:
Vill du arbeta med den senaste tekniken och forma framtidens BI- och datalösningar? På Knowit Datalytics söker vi en Lösningsarkitekt som vill kombinera strategi och teknik för att utveckla innovativa analytics-lösningar – med målet att skapa en bättre och mer hållbar framtid!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig:**
* En central och verksamhetskritisk roll där du arbetar med det senaste inom Microsoft ekosystem.
* En kreativ och stöttande arbetsmiljö med fokus på din personliga och professionella utveckling.
* Konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket med försäkring, pension, årsbonus och flexibla arbetstider.


**Om rollen och ditt team:**
 Hos Knowit Datalytics i Stockholm blir du en del av ett team om 50 skickliga specialister inom analytics och data management. Vi har en decentraliserad organisationsstruktur med snabba beslutsvägar, samtidigt som vi har kraften av en stor organisation med 4400 erfarna specialister i Sverige och Norden.
   

  

 Som lösningsarkitekt inom Business Intelligence arbetar du inom hela erbjudande- och leveranskedjan av analytics- och datamanagementlösningar, inklusive:
   

  

* Strategisk rådgivning, arkitektur och teknisk vägledning utifrån kundens behov.
* Design och implementation av analytics- och datamangement-lösningar
* Översätta behov till hållbara lösningar med kvalité och efterlevnad av IT- och säkerhetsföreskrifter


 Vi är övertygade om att AI inte bara förändrar hur vi löser tekniska problem, utan också hur vi samarbetar, kommunicerar och skapar värde. Därför söker vi dig som redan har testat, eller vill utforska, hur AI kan bidra till smartare arbetssätt och bättre resultat, både för oss själva och våra kunder.
   

  

**Om dig:**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har ett antal års erfarenhet inom rollen som lösningsarkitekt med erfarenhet av Microsoft data management produkter och tjänster, både onprem och i molnet. Vidare har du en teknisk bredd inom ETL och Data warehouse med ett intresse att arbeta nära tekniken.
   

  

 Som konsult har du en förmåga att samarbeta och anpassa din kommunikation för att förklara komplexa lösningar på olika nivåer. Du är lyhörd för behov, förutsättningar och möjligheter och kan omsätta dessa till tydliga mål och en effektiv leverans. Du är flytande i svenska och engelska.

title: Senior Enterprise Account Executive, Growth
description:
MongoDB’s mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build anywhere—on the edge, on premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 developers joining MongoDB every month, it’s no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a hardworking, driven individual with superb energy, passion and initiative for new business acquisition. The Account Executive role focuses exclusively on formulating and executing a sales strategy within an assigned territory, resulting in revenue growth and new customer acquisition.
   

  

 We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Stockholm for our hybrid working model.
   

  

**About The Sales Culture**
 MongoDB is always developing and innovating — not only in our technology, but also in our sales go-to-market strategy. Our sales leadership is committed to building the best salesforce in technology. This means, inspiring and enabling success for everyone on the team. We not only equip you to be successful and close deals, but we want your feedback and input on how we can continue to “Think Big and Go Far.” As a crucial part of the Sales team at MongoDB, you will have access to a lucrative market and learn how to sell from some of the most successful sales leaders in the software industry.
   

  

 What you will be doing
   

  

* Proactively, identify, qualify and close a sales pipeline
* Strategically prospect into CTOs, Engineering/IT Leaders, & technical end users
* Build strong and effective relationships, resulting in growth opportunities
* Partner with our Solution Architects and work closely with the Professional Services team to achieve customer satisfaction
* Work closely with the enterprise ecosystem partner sales and channel partner to maximize deal sizes


 What you will bring to the table
   

  

* 4+ years field experience of quota-carrying experience in a fast-paced and competitive market
* Demonstrated ability to open new accounts and run a complex sales process
* A proven track record of overachievement and hitting sales targets
* Ability to articulate the business value of complex enterprise technology
* Skilled in building business champions
* Driven and competitive. Possess a strong desire to be successful


 Things we love
   

  

* Passionate about growing your career in the largest market in software (database)
* Previous Sales Methodology training (e.g. MEDDIC, SPIN, Challenger Sales)
* Familiarity with databases, develops and open source technology a plus


 Why join now
   

  

* Accelerators up to 30%
* Best in breed Sales trainings in MEDDIC and Command of the Message, including our comprehensive Sales Bootcamps and development programs
* New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan
* Generous and competitive benefits (parental leave, fertility & wellbeing support)


 To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!
   

  

 MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.
   

  

 MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Senior Platform Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Internet Marketplace Platforms, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**About Gelato** 




 Gelato has created the world’s largest global network for on-demand production of custom products – from t-shirts and mugs to books and wall art. We empower a new generation of ecommerce entrepreneurs to share their creativity worldwide while embracing local, sustainable production. By producing locally and perfectly matching supply with demand, we eliminate waste and reduce carbon emissions.
 



  





 At Gelato, we don’t own production facilities – we build the software that connects them. With over 140 production partners in 32 countries, our network can deliver custom products to five billion people in just 72 hours. It’s smarter, faster, and greener.
 



  





 With GelatoConnect, our SaaS platform, we’re driving innovation in print production. GelatoConnect simplifies operations for print producers by automating procurement, workflows, and logistics into one seamless system. By boosting efficiency and cutting costs, it helps businesses scale to meet market demands. With GelatoConnect, we’re reshaping the print industry to be more efficient, sustainable, and profitable.
 



  





**Platform** 




**Gelato** 
 is an
 **AI-first** 
 , cloud-native platform transforming local, on-demand production and delivery — with zero physical assets. We power:
 


* **Global production orchestration** 
 : connecting e-commerce customers to 130+ partners across 32 countries. From AI-guided plate design to smart routing and logistics, we deliver to over 5 billion people in under 72 hours—faster, greener, smarter.
* **GelatoConnect** 
 : our AI-driven print production OS that helps producers master digital printing — from inventory to shipping — by automating every step: procurement, prepress, printing, packaging, and dispatch. It’s machine-agnostic, real-time, and built for uptime, precision, and profitability.



  





**AI at the Core** 




 We are not just early adopters of AI — we’re
 **AI-native builders** 
 . Across engineering, product, and operations, we embrace AI to accelerate innovation:
 


* **AI-first development** 
 using LLMs for code generation, testing, documentation, and design exploration.
* **Autonomous AI agents** 
 driving platform resilience, observability, cost control, and internal workflow automation.
* **AI-native product features** 
 built into GelatoConnect and the core platform — improving routing, personalization, and production optimization.
* A culture of
 **continuous experimentation** 
 with RAG, agent orchestration, prompt engineering, and model fine-tuning.



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Ensure 24/7 platform operations, including on-call support and incident response.
* Build and evolve
 **AI agents** 
 that automate scaling, recovery, and diagnostics through control-plane patterns and event-driven logic.
* Manage
 **multi-cloud infrastructure** 
 , including serverless, through declarative, automated workflows.
* Collaborate with the
 **Delivery Platform** 
 team to improve DevEx with intelligent internal tooling.
* Drive
 **reliability, observability, and cost-efficiency** 
 across Gelato’s global infrastructure.
* Enable engineers with
 **self-service, secure, and scalable delivery pipelines** 
 .



  





**Qualifications** 



* Deep understanding of
 **Linux fundamentals** 
 (processes, I/O, filesystems, networking, memory management, system internals).
* Deep experience with
 **AWS** 
 (primary)
 **and GCP** 
 (bonus), including cost optimizations, EKS, networking, S3, VPC peering, IAM, and related services.
* Strong understanding of
 **Kubernetes internals** 
 , including networking, security, and cluster operations.
* Hands-on experience with
 **GitOps workflows** 
 (e.g. ArgoCD) and
 **Infrastructure as Code** 
 using Terraform.
* Proficient in
 **Python, Go** 
 , or other languages — with a willingness to learn Go if not already familiar.
* Comfortable using
 **AI development tools** 
 like Cursor, Claude, and coding with LLMs.



  





 Experience with or strong interest in building
 **AI agents and RAG workflows** 
 , with a commitment to learn if needed.
 



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



  





 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.
 



  





 Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in
 **English** 
 , regardless of which country you are applying from.

title: Expert Content Manager
description:
Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.
   

  

 With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.
   

  

 This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our Expert Content Manager, you will play a pivotal role in crafting compelling healthcare communications for professionals across Sweden. Working within key categories like Pain, Oral Health, Respiratory, Smokers Health, and Wellness, you'll drive the creation and delivery of impactful content that empowers pharmacists, GPs, nurses, and key opinion leaders.
   

  

 Your expertise will bring together insights from brand teams, sales, and external partners to develop strategic messaging and toolkits for multiple channels, including digital platforms, conferences, and publications. Collaborating with creative agencies and associations, you will ensure our content stands out, delivers real value to healthcare professionals, and supports Haleon's mission to improve everyday health.
   

  

 If you are digitally savvy and eager to make a difference in a fast-paced environment—and want your work to reach and inspire healthcare experts, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Foster brand advocacy and recommendation among healthcare professionals, consumers, patients, and peers to drive net sales growth
* Oversee the comprehensive expert content strategy across various channels, including field force and digital initiatives, ensuring effective execution and KPI monitoring to promote healthcare professionals’ recommendations.
* Articulate and promote Haleon’s Sustainability agenda to targeted experts, supporting industry-wide transformation.
* Integrate expert marketing activation plans within the overarching brand strategy, contributing to brand NRM planning with defined expert plans, appropriate prize sizing, and required budgets.
* Establish clear expert communication objectives and provide guidance on deploying and amplifying global/BU expert content strategies and toolkits.
* Lead the implementation of global/Business Unit content and toolkits tailored to distinct expert audiences, ensuring effective multichannel execution—such as through Haleon Health Partner platforms, digital channels, and events—with robust performance tracking.
* Develop and deliver localized halo content as necessary, ensuring consistency of messaging between expert audiences and consumers/patients and adherence to local regulations and guidelines.
* Guarantee the availability of relevant content aligned with respective sales cycles in annual cycle planning.
* Collaborate with brand teams to identify content gaps, proactively address future content needs, and contribute to the development of new claims and toolkits for priority brands at the global or BU level.
* Identify, scale, and share best practices across BUs, disseminating learnings from local implementations and executions.
* Define and manage relationships with creative and production agencies to ensure quality deliverables.
* Work in partnership with local brand, medical, regulatory, customer marketing, sales teams, and the BU expert team to achieve all outlined objectives.


**Qualifications And Skills**
* University degree
* 5+ years in medical, brand, or expert marketing
* Strong understanding of the healthcare professionals, communication style and messaging particular to the community the content is delivered
* Digital marketing experience, including performance tracking
* Excellent communicator; fluent in Swedish and English


 Please save a copy of the job description, as this may be helpful to refer to once the advert closes.
   

  

**Diversity, Equity and Inclusion**
 At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.
   

  

 We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.
   

  

 We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.
   

  

 Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/
   

  

 At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone. We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.
   

  

 As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information, which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.
   

  

 Haleon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.
   

  

 Accommodation Requests
   

  

 If you require a reasonable accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at Haleon at any stage of the application process, please let your recruiter know by providing them with a description of specific accommodations you are requesting. We’ll provide all reasonable accommodations to support you throughout the recruitment process and treat all information you provide us in confidence.

title: Product Owner Swedish payment products
job_function: Project Management, Business Development, and Information Technology
description:
Are you ready to be part of the exciting transformation in the world of payments and improve everyday life for businesses and millions of people across Sweden?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Hold product and process ownership for the product functional delivery
* Be responsible for setting the strategy of a product through market insight, including establishing a product that have sustainable customer value and enduring revenue and profit for the business
* Be accountable for the end-to-end process of the product lifecycle, i.e. capturing business requirement, ensure functional requirements related to for instance, but not limited to, regulations, and IT solutions
* Planning and managing the product roadmap, ensuring that all necessary business requirements are provided. This includes ownership for the agreed product ensuring that solutions delivered meet customer and business needs whilst adhering to legal, risk and compliance requirements of the bank.
* Be responsible for potential collaboration with third parties to improve the product offering


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Deep product knowledge as product owner (minimum 5 years) within payments infrastructure landscape, payments products and product steering
* Proven experience in leading team across units with strong ability to guide teams towards strategic goals
* Fundamental knowledge of all aspects of payments including customer needs, rulebooks, compliance requirements, technology integration, and operational processes
* Previous experience in working with developing ISO product offering, e.g. at a Nordic bank (meritorious but not required)


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 become part of a team of professional colleagues, who work together to deliver challenging projects, maximize customer satisfaction and contribute to Swedbank's position in society. At Swedbank, we are reshaping our payment offerings to create innovative, efficient, and impactful solutions that's vital to the fabric of society. If you're looking for a dynamic role where your ideas can thrive and make a difference, we invite you to join us on our journey!"

 We look forward to receiving your application by 17.08.2025.

title: Financial Sanctions Regulatory Specialist – Economic Crime Prevention
company_industry: Banking, Financial Services, and Legal Services
description:
Are you interested in regulatory interpretation, implementation and risk management within Financial Sanctions?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Together with a great team of talented specialists work with Financial Crime regulations within an international environment, with colleagues in Norway, Finland, New York, Shanghai and the Baltic countries.
* Interpret external and internal regulations within Financial Sanctions to determine the impact for Swedbank.
* Establish and update internal frameworks and support implementation within the business areas.
* Advise and support the economic crime prevention organisation, customer organisations and senior management.
* Collaborate with group functions and the business areas within the bank.
* Together with experienced colleagues coordinate and run projects within Financial Sanctions.
* Support with regulatory expertise to Group wide Financial Sanctions trainings.
* Be part of the continued building of Strategic Management and Advice unit in the Economic Crime Prevention organisation


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* A bachelor or master’s degree in law.
* 5-7yrs documented experience working in a senior role with governance and framework within Financial Sanctions at a bank or other financial institution or competent authority.
* The ability to work independently in a structured and organised manner. Proactive and helpful attitude, high integrity, solution oriented and relation building team player.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to express yourself in English, orally and in writing. Including the ability to present complex matters in a simple and understandable way.


***Desired experience:***
* Regulatory competence in Governance.
* Project lead.
* Using artificial intelligence as a tool in daily work with regulations and frameworks.


 With us, you can experience:
